programme.title: Star Trek
programme.desc: Spock's ailing father Ambassador Sarek holds peace talks for a group of feuding alien diplomats while suffering from heart problems, and it soon emerges his son may be the only person who can cure him. Starring William Shatner, Leonard Nimoy and DeForest Kelley

programme.title: Star Trek: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Part one of two. The Enterprise encounters sadistic Borg who have rediscovered their individuality - and as a result of the run-in, Data develops the ability to experience rage. Starring Brent Spiner and Patrick Stewart, with a guest appearance by Professor Stephen Hawking

programme.desc: Starbuck's aggressive rival in a triad match is found dead after the game, prompting Apollo to risk his neck to clear his friend's name. Sci-fi drama, starring Dirk Benedict, Richard Hatch and Lorne Greene

programme.title: Five Golden Dragons (1967)
programme.desc: A businessman in Hong Kong receives a mysterious message from a murder victim. As he tries to work out what it means, he is drawn into a deadly confrontation with a band of five ruthless master criminals. Action adventure, starring Robert Cummings and Margaret Lee

programme.title: Star Trek
programme.desc: The unexpected presence of Klingon warriors on a mineral-rich world jeopardises delicate negotiations for a treaty with the Federation. Kirk and his crew end up trying to prevent a war and drive their deadliest foes from the planet. Guest starring Julie Newmar

programme.title: Star Trek: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Part two of two. Data's malevolent brother Lore persuades him to join forces with the Borg, and he responds by taking Picard hostage - leaving Dr Crusher in charge of a skeleton crew aboard the Enterprise. Patrick Stewart and Brent Spiner star

programme.title: Battlestar Galactica

programme.title: Walker, Texas Ranger
programme.desc: Alex takes on a gang of arsonists who try to murder the firefighters called out to extinguish their fires

programme.title: Soldier Blue (1970)
programme.desc: Shockingly violent Western that caused controversy on release, pulling no punches as it follows the US Cavalry's involvement in the extermination of the Cheyenne, while two survivors of an Indian raid struggle to make it to safety. Candice Bergen, Peter Strauss, Donald Pleasence and John Anderson star

programme.title: The Neighbour (2016)
programme.desc: In Mississippi, small-time drug-traffickers John and Rosie decide to leave the narcotics business behind, and instead plan to double-cross their boss. However, when Rosie goes missing, John makes a disturbing discovery in his secretive neighbour's cellar. Horror thriller, starring Josh Stewart, Bill Engvall, Alex Essoe and Ronnie Gene Blevins

programme.title: The Windmill Massacre (2016)
programme.desc: Tourists on a coach tour of the Netherlands find themselves stranded when their vehicle breaks down in the remote countryside beside an old windmill that appears neither on their itinerary nor any maps. With no mechanic willing to venture out until the next day, they have to stay overnight and begin to be picked off and dispatched with gruesome violence, realising that their dark secrets have resurrected a local blood-soaked medieval legend. Horror, starring Charlotte Beaumont and Noah Taylor

programme.title: Paranormal Activity (2007)
programme.desc: A couple move into a new house, only to be disturbed by unexplained supernatural phenomena. They become convinced the property is haunted and set out to capture evidence of their ghostly encounters on film. An attempt to directly contact the spirits only makes matters worse. Horror, starring Katie Featherston and Micah Sloat

programme.desc: Strickland's Whitehall pal Stephen Fisher is targeted by an assassin, so the Ucos boss enlists the team to find whoever was responsible. He reveals that 30 years earlier, he and Fisher were involved in a covert MI5 operation to break into the house of a journalist believed to have information on an IRA arms deals. But with several of the original agents having died in suspicious circumstances, he believes someone is out to kill them all - and when a connection is made between a gangster and MI5, it seems the threat may be coming from within the security service itself. Tim McInnerny and Kerry Fox guest star

programme.desc: Sally Lindsay joins Alexander Armstrong to co-host the quiz, in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the most obscure answers

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Another mix of nationwide reports and live studio-based chat with Lauren Laverne and Jermaine Jenas

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Kim organises a karaoke leaving party for Lola but forgets to hire a karaoke machine. Eve becomes suspicious of Stacey and Kat tries to stick up for Alfie when she learns Elaine wants rid of him at The Vic

programme.title: Waterloo Road
programme.desc: Kim is rocked by a blast from the past and a new pupil causes problems. Joe and Mike begin to question their future as they are faced with the realities of fatherhood. Kai struggles with his feeling for Preston and Danny makes a bold move as his future hangs in the balance

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The remaining 14 chefs kick off Knockout Week by being split into two groups. The first group of seven cook a dish that they would have on the menu of their own restaurant or pop-up, or would feature in their cookbook. Guest judge Anna Haugh joins John Torode to decide which five will go on to cook at a restaurant and which two will be going home. The remaining five head to Kings Cross in London to work at Decimo under chef Peter Sanchez-Iglesias. During a busy lunch service, the five amateurs will be entirely responsible for serving the restaurant's menu to paying customers

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Rain Dogs
programme.desc: After receiving some news that might change her circumstances, Costello prepares to leave London with Iris. But as mounting pressure online threatens to take away their escape route, Costello falls back into bad habits. After a visit from Fen, Selby opens up about his father and gets heated with his therapist. Gloria struggles to come to terms with becoming a mother

programme.title: The Truth About
programme.desc: Over the past 12 months, a team from Imperial College London, in collaboration with the BBC, have surveyed the mental health of over 350,000 people across the UK during the Covid-19 pandemic. Now, clinical psychologist Professor Tanya Byron joins former England footballer Alex Scott to discover how the latest science can help us gain greater control over our state of mind and improve mental health and wellbeing

programme.title: This Is Spinal Tap (1984)
programme.desc: An ageing British rock band try to revive their fortunes by embarking on a US tour, with a film-maker on hand to record the mayhem. However, the big comeback soon turns into a series of disasters as tensions between the clueless rockers and their long-suffering manager reach breaking point. Spoof documentary, starring Michael McKean, Christopher Guest, Harry Shearer and Rob Reiner

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Jon Kay and Sally Nugent present a round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Rip Off Britain
programme.desc: Julia, Gloria and Angela hear from online shoppers who received the wrong order but were refused a refund and look at the importance of reading terms and conditions

programme.title: Frontline Fightback
programme.desc: A look at the dog DNA database that is being used to reunite pets with their owners and the laser scanning technology that is helping create detailed 3D digital crime scenes

programme.title: Defenders UK
programme.desc: DVSA inspectors investigate the cause of a fatal HGV crash, finding faulty brakes to blame. Trading Standards take action against a builder charging people for unfinished work

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Dion Dublin is in Wolverhampton to see a three-bedrom, end-of-terrace house with scope to extend. He's also in Willenhall in the West Midlands to visit a bungalow which might offer more potential as a new building plot. In Norfolk, Tommy Walsh visits a three-bedroom house that he's a big fan of

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: The reds and blues go bargain hunting in Lincolnshire, with the help of experts Nick Hall and Gary Pe. Plus, presenter Charlie Ross learns about learns about the rules on finding treasure at the bottom of the garden

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Scarlett and Ollie struggle with their masterplan and Nina is unsure about Bear's replacement receptionist. Daniel struggles to help a grieving friend

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: The team head to Beaconsfield Recycling Centre for items to upcycle. Jacqui finds a tired toolbox to transform, Sarah takes on a glass bookcase and Bruce finds a dated sideboard

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: With their current townhouse bursting at the seams, today's couple - along with their five children and two dogs - need Ginny Buckley's help to find a large rural property. In West Yorkshire, they get the local lowdown from both Ginny and her mum Maggie. Having grown up in the area, Ginny also finds out what it is to be a proud Yorkshire person

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: Nigel Havers hosts as five dealers battle each other to buy items brought in by the public, including a giant fibreglass gorilla and a 1940s drinks cabinet and lamp

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Jay Blades and the experts revive a magician's top hat that once belonged to the owner's uncle, a metal case used to hold signwriters' tools and a mechanical model that stood proudly on display in a butcher's shop for decades

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Sally Lindsay joins Alexander Armstrong to co-host the quiz, in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the most obscure answers

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Live chat and topical reports, presented by Alex Jones and Jermaine Jenas

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Lola learns her palliative chemotherapy treatment did not work. Stacey and Martin share a heart-to-heart as they learn that Lily is bullying a girl at school and Sonia steps in to help Kim with her anxiety

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Jay Blades and his team of experts meet Liz from Dorset who brings in a crumbling cast-iron gate built by her brother as a gift for her and her late husband. Horologist Steve Fletcher and leather expert Suzie Fletcher are brought a century-old watch by Nancy who's father was awarded the watch for his bravery on his return from the First World War. Upholsterer Sonnaz Nooranvary takes on a rocking chair that has been at the heart of Anna's family home for decades and is in desperate need of some TLC. Last into the shop is Ruth and her Auntie Roz who bring in a penny arcade game from the 1920s

programme.title: Matt Willis: Fighting Addiction
programme.desc: Bassist and co-founder of Busted Matt Willis opens up about his experiences battling drug and alcohol addiction and his daily struggle to stay clean and sober. He speaks on the constant fear of relapse and the pressure it puts on himself and his family. Matt looks back on his past and his darkest days, trying to get to the root of his addictions. He visits a rehab unit that made a real difference to his recovery to speak with experts about why he and fellow addicts become dependent on drugs and alcohol before travelling to Imperial College London to meet a research team who are studying the differences in the brains of people with addictions and people without

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: I Kissed a Boy
programme.desc: Dannii Minogue presents a dating show for gay men, welcoming 10 contestants to Italy to stay in a beautiful country house called the Masseria. Before the summer of love starts, the boys are matched up based on what they're looking for in a partner, before they have even spoken to each other. After meeting their match for the first time with a kiss, the contenders are encouraged to get to know them and give their new relationship a good shot

programme.title: I Kissed a Boy
programme.desc: It's the morning after the Pride before and the boys are reeling from the arrival of new boy Mikey, who is already turning some heads, Ben questions his feelings for Ollie, and the masseria sees its first love triangle. Everyone has a big decision to make at the first Kiss-Off

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Charlie Stayt and Naga Munchetty present a round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Rip Off Britain
programme.desc: Angela Rippon, Gloria Hunniford and Julia Somerville report on the woman whose credit rating was ruined after scammers took out multiple mobile phone contracts in her name. She only found out when she tried to apply for a mortgage

programme.title: Frontline Fightback
programme.desc: How a young couple's new glamping business was threatened when their Instagram account was hacked into and taken over. The hacker demanded $500 to hand back control - but they stood their ground. Incidents like this are increasingly common, with more than half of small businesses suffering a cyberattack in the last 12 months. Rav Wilding looks at the work being done by West Midlands Cybercrime Unit to combat the problem

programme.title: Defenders UK
programme.desc: Investigators search for a roofer who conned people out of more than half a million pounds, and a fraudster who lied to get a job as a Captain with one of the UK's largest airlines

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts and Martel Maxwell tour a Cornish period house with several old cars hidden in the overgrown back garden. Properties in Co Durham and south Wales about to be sold are also assessed

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin Sharp presents from Newbury Antiques and Collectors Fair in Berkshire, where experts Charles Hanson and David Harper help two teams acquire items of value to take to auction. The host also pops across to Bristol to meet the maker of cigar box guitars

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Rob cooks up a storm, while Zara gets to grips with her new role. Bear meets an old college friend with big ambitions

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore explores Beaconsfield recycling centre in Buckinghamshire, determined to save quality items from being crushed. There's a sliding door sideboard for furniture painter Chloe Kempster and a collection of wooden skis for lighting designer Duncan McKean. Sarah herself gets crafty with a collection of knitted blankets and patches. Narrated by Arthur Smith

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman returns to her Kent roots to help a young family currently in London find a new home. Away from the house hunt, Nicki takes a trip down memory lane, meeting up with her best friend from school, before they join Nicki's mother at the family's beach hut in Herne Bay

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: Nigel Havers presents the programme in which five dealers bid against one another to buy intriguing items brought in by members of the public, including a toy cafeteria truck, a surprising key, and Victorian Children's clogs

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: A painting depicting the Lebanese city of Beirut arrives at the barn. It was painted by Nonny Jackson-Twist's grandfather just after the Second World War. He would very much like to hang the painting in his home, but it's faded, the canvas cracked and in some sections the paint is flaking away. However, fine art conservator Lucia Scalisi is only too happy to take on this monumental task. Also being restored are pair of silver Shabbat candlesticks and a dilapidated car jack. Presented by Jay Blades

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong hosts the quiz in which contestants try to record the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Former Coronation Street Sally Lindsay reveals the correct answers and comments on the players' scores

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Live chat and topical reports, presented by Alex Jones and Roman Kemp

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Jay breaks Lola out of hospital for a fun-filled day at the seaside but it quickly goes south as the pair get in trouble with the police after Lola steals a necklace to give to Lexi for her 16th birthday

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The second group of seven hopefuls compete for the chance to work in a professional kitchen for the first time. They must cook a dish they would have on the menu of their own restaurant or pop-up, or feature in their cookbook. With Gregg unwell, Monica Galetti joins John Torode to decide which two will be going home, after which the remaining five work in the Royal Opera House's Piazza restaurant, under the guidance of executive chef Richard Robinson. But only the best will make it through to the semi-final

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars
programme.desc: The semi-finalists have their social media skills tested as they are challenged to sell a local street food brand online, under the watchful eye of TIkTok sensation Uncle Roger. Next, Gordon tasks the contestants to devise a recipe to appear on the front page of Waitrose's in-house magazine, before presenting their creations in front of undercover experts including world-renowned food photographer, Mary McCartney. Who will impress Gordon and make it to the final?

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the topical debate, inviting a panel of politicians and other guests in Fort William, Inverness-shire, to answer questions from an invited audience on subjects that have made the headlines over the past week

programme.title: Newscast
programme.desc: BBC journalists including Adam Fleming and Chris Mason host a weekly round-up from Westminster, delivering the usual mix of serious analysis and light-hearted gossip about the biggest stories in politics

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin Sharp visits Stirling Castle to see a museum about the Argyll and Sutherland Highlanders Regiment. Leading the teams are experts Roo Irvine and Danny Sebastian

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Sonali Shah is house-hunting in Norfolk for a buyer who wants to establish holiday lets and also rehome dogs in need. They pay a visit to a local animal sanctuary for advice

programme.title: Coast to Coast Food Festival
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher explores the food festival at Llangollen, where local food experts reveal their passion for their produce. Farmer Jim Smith tests his tastebuds with some hot sauces in Edinburgh, chef Suzie Lee discovers the key to producing cider in Armagh, and the secrets behind making a homemade pie on a budget are revealed

programme.title: Coastal Defenders
programme.desc: The diving team get a late call from a boat in peril. A missing lifeboat cannister means a ferry is unable to sail, causing chaos for the passengers that use the service for their daily commute. It's a needle-in-a-haystack hunt in near-zero visibility - and to make matters worse, local leisure cruisers create imminent danger for the diver underwater

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: Politics Live
programme.desc: The latest stories from Westminster and beyond

programme.title: The Super League Show
programme.desc: Tanya Arnold presents action from the latest fixtures, including Wigan Warriors v Leeds Rhinos, Warrington Wolves v Hull Kingston Rovers and St Helens v Salford Red Devils

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the quiz in which contestants compete for the chance to win 10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: Eat Well for Less?
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace and Chris Bavin help the Gambling family in Ealing, west London, lower their food bills. Douglas and Angella are two self-confessed 'foodies' who like to keep their kitchen stocked up with high-quality products. Now the couple have two young children, they find themselves increasingly reliant on takeaway meals and pre-measured ingredient boxes. Can Gregg and Chris get the programme's biggest ever spenders to change their food shopping habits?

programme.title: Beechgrove Repotted
programme.desc: A look at the transformation of Edinburgh's Saughton Park from a neglected site into a model educational facility with a physic garden

programme.title: Interior Design Masters
programme.desc: The contestants are sent to Wotton House, a grand hotel in the Surrey Hills, where they must each transform one of the nine bedrooms to create a space that reflects their signature style but with an eccentric British twist. The designers relish the challenge, embracing the idea of British eccentricity, although some take a more liberal approach, leading to surprising results. Alan Carr follows their progress, while helping Michelle Ogundehin survey the spaces is guest judge Guy Oliver, who has designed the interiors for some of the best-known hotels in London

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Paul Martin presents the show from Croome, a Palladian mansion in Worcestershire, where experts Adam Partridge and David Fletcher find a hand-operated fire pump

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Nabil Abdulrashid, Luke Kempner, Sarah Millican and Philippa Perry go toe-to-toe testing their general knowledge skills in a variety of trivia-based games across the week

programme.title: Clive Myrie's Italian Road Trip
programme.desc: Clive visits Bologna, considered by many to be Italy's food capital, where he leans to make perfect pasta and finds out why an osteria - an Italian wine bar - is superior to a pub. But it's not all food and drink as he also dons his hard hat and climbs some scaffolding to learn the history of an 800-year-old tower

programme.title: Digging for Britain
programme.desc: Alice Roberts visits more archaeological digs around the country, finding out about discoveries that shed new light on British history during the prehistoric, Roman, Saxon and Tudor eras. In this edition she heads to a spectacular monument that is older than Stonehenge, a 200-year-old mine trapped in time, and a lost medieval friary

programme.title: Inside the Factory
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace visits the Denby factory in Derbyshire, which has been making pottery since 1809. Gregg follows production of one of the factory's best sellers, the Halo Heritage mug. Meanwhile, Cherry Healey visits a cutting-edge car factory that uses clay to make life-sized models of its new designs. She also has a go at the intricate art of pattern printing onto a teapot at the Burleigh pottery factory in Stoke-on-Trent

programme.title: Forensics: The Real CSI
programme.desc: Documentary revealing the crucial role that forensics plays in bringing criminals to justice. A woman arrives at a police station to report she has been raped. The victim agrees to undergo a forensic examination to recover potentially critical evidence and the hunt to identify her unknown attacker begins

programme.title: Colin from Accounts
programme.desc: Ashley takes Gordon to her birthday dinner at the home of Lynelle and creepy Professor Lee. Australian comedy, starring Patrick Brammall and Harriet Dyer

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events with Kirsty Wark

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Moonlight (2016)
programme.desc: A young African-American man in a rough Miami neighbourhood grapples with his identity and sexuality while experiencing the everyday struggles of childhood, adolescence and burgeoning adulthood. He finds support from a drug dealer and his kindly girlfriend, who can see he is being neglected and offer him sanctuary. Barry Jenkins' Oscar-winning drama, starring Mahershala Ali, Naomie Harris, Alex Hibbert, Ashton Sanders and Trevante Rhodes

programme.title: Murder in the Pacific
programme.desc: Documentary examining the May 1985 bombing of Greenpeace ship Rainbow Warrior, a symbol of peace that had just returned from a visit to the Marshall Islands in the Pacific Ocean, where the inhabitants were suffering the effects of nuclear fallout following the 1954 testing of American H-bomb Bravo. After travelling south to Auckland harbour, New Zealand, two explosions sank the ship and killed a crew member

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: Nine more contenders enter the kitchen in the fourth round of heats, preparing a family favourite which Gregg Wallace and John Torode will judge blind, before granting three of the cooks a pass to the next round. The six remaining competitors face an invention test to earn their place in the contest, after which two will find themselves falling at the first hurdle

programme.title: A Special School
programme.desc: Documentary following life at Ysgol y Der in Penarth, the Vale of Glamorgan, which is Britain's biggest special school. It's the first day back after the summer holidays and headteacher Chris Britten recalls the strain of staying open during the pandemic, while some of the young pupils go on the first field trip of the year. Back at school, staff have to act quickly to try to control the situation when a sixth-former who finds it hard to control his emotions and temper has an outburst and escapes from class. Narrated by Iwan Rheon

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: The team transforms an old washstand, a broken-up sofa, and a collection of vintage clothing, picked up by Sarah Moore at Wallyford Recycling Centre

programme.title: 24/7 Pet Hospital
programme.desc: A labrador is rushed in with a swelling on its tongue, a spaniel's ongoing symptoms need investigating and a Bernese mountain dog is back with joint problems and may need surgery

programme.desc: Former make-up artist Piers hosts the last hike in north west Wales as he treats the group to a seaside extravaganza

programme.title: Eat Well for Less?
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace and Chris Bavin are in Belfast, where they meet Steve Carter, who ever since his wife's death nine years ago has been bringing up his four children alone. But the family are stuck in a food rut, eating ready meals, filling up on snacks and buying expensive protein drinks. Can the experts help Steve provide healthier meals for himself and his kids?

programme.title: Secret Britain
programme.desc: The presenters explore Kent, with Denise Lewis abseiling off the White Cliffs of Dover in search of a rare plant, Ellie Harrison heading to Kent's furthest outpost, and Chris Hollins discovering the secrets of the North Kent marshes

programme.title: Interior Design Masters
programme.desc: The designers go back to school as they transform students' common rooms - and Michelle Ogundehin ups the stakes by telling them that the weakest two will be eliminated this week. Arriving at Gordano School in Bristol, the contestants work in pairs to update the four tired areas - one for each house in the school - as well as adjoining teachers' offices. Alan Carr follows their progress, while guest judge Sophie Robinson offers her thoughts on the finished designs

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Philip Serrel and Catherine Southon find intricately carved walnuts and a silver epergne at Bletchley Park, Buckinghamshire, while Paul Martin meets Second World War codebreakers

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Nabil Abdulrashid, Luke Kempner, Sarah Millican and Philippa Perry test their general knowledge in a variety of trivia-based games across the week, with a winner declared on Friday

programme.title: Clive Myrie's Italian Road Trip
programme.desc: Clive's Italian adventure continues with visits to Verona, Treviso, Lake Garda and the village of Limone, along the way learning how to make tiramisu and finding out how the balcony inspired by Shakespeare's Romeo and Juliet now brings lovers from all over the world. He also meets up with an old friend and learns why Italians live some of the longest lives in Europe

programme.title: Digging for Britain
programme.desc: Alice Roberts visits more archaeological digs around the country, finding out about a gatehouse riddled with Civil War bullets, a unique Iron Age shield made from bark, and Roman burials with pots where the heads should be

programme.title: Designing the Hebrides
programme.desc: To launch a new spirit distilled on the cheese farm where he lives, Banjo Beale is asked to design a rustic gin-tasting bar using salvaged materials found on the farm. This design is deeply personal journey for Banjo, as he aims to give back to the people who welcomed him and his husband Ro into their community, but with a launch party looming, and an ambitious plan to complete, will it live up to expectations?

programme.title: Wales' Home of the Year
programme.desc: The search for Wales' Home of the Year 2022 concludes with the spotlight on the final five homes - the winners of each regional episode. However, only one of them can triumph, so judges Owain Wyn Evans, Mandy Watkins and Glen Thomas invite the owners to Llancaiach Fawr Tudor manor house in the heart of the Rhymney Valley where they assess the homes again, scoring them on architectural merit, distinctive design and original style. The five are whittled to three, and then just one - the overall winner of Wales' Home of the Year 2022

programme.title: 11 Minutes: America's Deadliest Mass Shooting
programme.desc: Documentary about the attack on the 2017 Route 91 Harvest music festival in Las Vegas that left 60 dead and hundreds injured, using first-hand accounts and never-before-seen footage to chart the events. The first instalment reveals how 22,000 fans were at the celebration of country music when the gunfire started as headliner Jason Aldean opened his first set, and amid the confusion, groups of friends and families try to flee but get separated

programme.title: 11 Minutes: America's Deadliest Mass Shooting
programme.desc: A look at how a deluge of 911 calls caused concern that multiple shooters were on the Las Vegas strip, while a police officer dragged his bleeding partner to safety. Between bursts of automatic gunfire, concert-goers made a run for it if they could, while SWAT officers converged on the Mandalay Bay Hotel, where had information that the shooter was on the 32nd floor

programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events with Victoria Derbyshire

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.desc: The BBC's world affairs editor reflects on the week's major global news stories, talking to local experts from around the world to go behind the headlines

programme.title: Forensics: The Real CSI
programme.desc: Documentary revealing the crucial role that forensics plays in bringing criminals to justice. A woman arrives at a police station to report she has been raped. The victim agrees to undergo a forensic examination to recover potentially critical evidence and the hunt to identify her unknown attacker begins

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars
programme.desc: Gordon celebrates the very best of British - exquisite produce and the pinnacle of fine dining. First, he invites his entrepreneurs to the Fish Society in Surrey where he tasks them with perfectly de-shelling one of the most expensive foods to be found on any menu - lobster. He then puts the contenders in charge of his high-end Mayfair restaurant, Lucky Cat. With his reputation on the line and paying diners expecting immaculate food and service, he expects them to live up to his own extraordinarily high standards in order to have any hope of proceeding in the competition

programme.title: Saving Lives in Leeds
programme.desc: Seventy six-year-old Barry is on the cardiac ward, waiting for a double bypass - but a shortage of beds means his operation has already been cancelled twice in two weeks. Cardiac surgeon Betsy Evans is hoping it will be third time lucky today as she prepares to take him into theatre. Others hoping their operations will go ahead are 57-year-old Dawn, who is having a cancerous tumour removed from her brain, and 15-year-old Jack, who has waited more than a year to correct his curved spine

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The seven best home cooks from the first rounds of the competition return to the MasterChef kitchen to face two new challenges. Jimi Famurewa, one of the country's toughest food critics,sets the challenge for the chefs to cook a dish made of leftovers or waste. Only the best cooks will remain to go on to the second challenge, creating a dish celebrating citrus. Hosted by John Torode and Gregg Wallace

programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: Eat Well for Less?
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace and Chris Bavin meet the Waltons in Nottinghamshire, a family with a high-sugar diet that is having a serious impact on their health and their bank balance. Couple Rita and Pete have both been diagnosed with Type 2 Diabetes, and Gregg and Chris are stunned by this couple's serious sugar addiction when they oversee their shopping

programme.title: Secret Britain
programme.desc: The presenters travel across Britain in search of places of natural beauty, this time exploring Devon. Ellie Harrison follows in Drakes footsteps and searches for the area's best kept secrets, while Chris Hollins relives an ancient and long-forgotten purification ritual on Dartmoor. Plus, Denise Lewis uncovers the secret history of the county's most reluctant visitors

programme.title: Interior Design Masters
programme.desc: The designers hit the high street in Salisbury, where they work in pairs to give three retail businesses - a bridal shop, a homeware shop and a lingerie shop - a new lease of life. The designs range from the theatrical, with bold colours and wallpapers, and a cool, contemporary theme, to a safe, colourless look that plays into the hands of an owner who was worried about change. Alan Carr follows their progress, while retail expert Mary Portas joins Michelle Ogundehin to offer her thoughts on the finished designs

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: A compilation edition, featuring finds at Bletchley Park, the Ulster Transport Museum and Crowcombe Court. Plus, Paul Martin uncovers a fascinating family history in Cornwall

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Nabil Abdulrashid, Luke Kempner, Sarah Millican and Philippa Perry keep their eyes on the prize ahead of Friday's final, while Richard Osman asks the questions

programme.title: Clive Myrie's Italian Road Trip
programme.desc: Clive is in Venice, where he wants to see what it's like to be a local, outnumbered by tourists by more than 200 to one. He starts out by learning the art of the gondolier, and soon learns that steering with just one oar is much more difficult than it looks. He then gets a lesson in glass-blowing and picks peppers on a farm in the Venetian lagoon

programme.title: Amol Rajan Interviews
programme.desc: An interview with Bob Woodward and Carl Bernstein, the journalists at the heart of the Watergate scandal, about the fall of Nixon, the presidency of Trump and the state of America and the world today. Amol Rajan questions the pair on some of the most important issues of modern times and explores the parallels between recent events and the scandal that eventually led to the resignation of the 37th US president

programme.title: Grand Tours of Scotland's Lochs
programme.desc: Paul Murton travels from Britain's most westerly mainland point to a place once guarded by an ancient Celtic goddess. On the way he discovers how the ancient oak woods of Loch Sunart were once a hive of industry and then goes deep underground to discover how 18th-century miners named a new element. On the shores of Loch Linnhe, he meets the owner of a castle and recreates a scene from Monty Python's Holy Grail

programme.title: DNA Family Secrets
programme.desc: A 79-year-old woman who grew up in a Nazi concentration camp as a Jewish orphan longs to know more about her family, and whether any of her relatives escaped the Holocaust. Stacey Dooley also meets Liverpool-born Maureen, who wants to know if her father was actually an African American GI who fell in love with her mother during the Second World War

programme.title: Guilt
programme.desc: Max has a plan to seize Sir Jim Sturrock's money from Maggie Lynch, but he won't tell Jake what it is, leaving his brother close to entering a secret alliance with Sheila. Maggie meets with her estranged daughter Erin and reveals that Max is back in Edinburgh, but she has revelations of her own

programme.title: Inside No 9
programme.desc: Wolfie and Clarke love their bus - but perhaps not as much as the mysterious Mr Cole and his nieces. The latest in the anthology of darkly comic tales, written by and starring Steve Pemberton and Reece Shearsmith, with a guest appearance from Robin Askwith

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events with Victoria Derbyshire

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: The Stones and Brian Jones
programme.desc: Nick Broomfield examines the life and legacy of the founder member of the Rolling Stones, looking at the relationships and rivalries within the band in their formative years. Featuring revealing interviews with all the main players and previously unseen archive footage, the film explores the creative musical genius of Jones, key to the success of the band, and uncovers how he was left behind in the shadows of history

programme.title: Inside the Factory
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace visits the Vale of Mowbray pork pie factory in Northallerton, Yorkshire, where the traditional pastries have been made since 1928. Gregg finds out which cuts of pork are used and is shown how to make the hot water pastry that acts as a strong 'container' for the pork filling. Meanwhile, Cherry Healey reveals hacks for the perfect vegan short crust pastry and takes to the wheel to learn how to drive one of the HGVs transporting food products around the country every day

programme.title: Dr Xand's Con or Cure
programme.desc: Health consumer show with Dr Xand van Tulleken and journalist Ashley John-Baptiste. The first episode looks at the dangers of health tourism and catching a cold

programme.title: Iolo's Borderlands
programme.desc: Iolo Williams explores the borderlands of Radnorshire, searching for nesting birds along the Wye, dormice and roe deer in its woodlands. He also finds yellowhammers on Offa's Dyke

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The fourth quarter-final sees the week's most talented four cooks return to fight for a place in Knockout Week. They must cook two courses that will excite not just regular judges John Torode and Gregg Wallace, but also 2020 champion Thomas Frake, 2010 champion Dhruv Baker and 2021 finalist Alexina Anatole. All three of their forerunners have gone on to forge careers in the food industry

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Railways: The Making of a Nation
programme.desc: Liz McIvor explores how Britain's expanding rail network was the spark to a social revolution, starting in the 1800s and continuing through to modern times. She begins by examining the introduction of precise railway schedules and timetables that recognised Greenwich Mean Time. However, in a country made up of separate local time zones, with clocks in the west set several minutes behind those in the east, not everyone was keen to step in line

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Age of Steam
programme.desc: Fred looks at early experiments in the use of steam for road transport, more than 100 years before the invention of the petrol engine. Plus, an insight into the development of the traction engine for agriculture and haulage

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: A chance encounter leads to an invitation for Jean to stay at her sister-in-law's home, but she has to persuade Lionel to accompany her. Comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer

programme.title: Whatever Happened to the Likely Lads?
programme.desc: Bob takes Terry on a tour of their old haunts - only to reveal most of them have been demolished. Terry finds it difficult accepting that times have changed during his time away - and a job interview proves the last straw. Classic comedy, with James Bolam and Rodney Bewes

programme.title: Dam Busters Declassified
programme.desc: Actor Martin Shaw takes to the skies in a bid to separate the facts from the myths surrounding the famous 1943 raid by 617 Squadron, which used bouncing bombs to attack German dams. He also talks to the last living RAF veteran of the mission, as well as to a survivor of the flooding caused by the breaching of the Moehne dam, and meets the secret wartime girlfriend of pilot Guy Gibson

programme.title: Storyville
programme.desc: Documentary-maker Bat-dor Ojalvo is given extraordinary access to one of Israel's most Orthodox Hasidic communities to explore the scandal that erupted when the rabbi who established and led the community died. There follows a story of inheritance battles, violent reprisals, sexual abuse and underage marriages, told by those that experienced it

programme.title: Britain and the Sea
programme.desc: David Dimbleby continues his voyage around Britain, sailing his yacht Rocket along coastal regions of the South East, the first point of attack for enemy forces and therefore essential to the nation's defence throughout history. Along the way, he takes a tour of HMS Victory, Nelson's flagship vessel from the Battle of Trafalgar, lovingly preserved in dry dock in Portsmouth. He also meets a carpenter who still makes wooden figureheads, discovers how a chamber pot acted as propaganda in the battle against Napoleon and reveals the way abstract art was used to deceive German submarine pilots

programme.title: Railways: The Making of a Nation
programme.desc: Liz McIvor explores how Britain's expanding rail network was the spark to a social revolution, starting in the 1800s and continuing through to modern times. She begins by examining the introduction of precise railway schedules and timetables that recognised Greenwich Mean Time. However, in a country made up of separate local time zones, with clocks in the west set several minutes behind those in the east, not everyone was keen to step in line

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Age of Steam
programme.desc: Fred looks at early experiments in the use of steam for road transport, more than 100 years before the invention of the petrol engine. Plus, an insight into the development of the traction engine for agriculture and haulage

programme.title: Dam Busters Declassified

He also talks to the last living RAF veteran of the mission, as well as to a survivor of the flooding caused by the breaching of the Moehne dam, and meets the secret wartime girlfriend of pilot Guy Gibson

programme.title: Britain and the Sea
programme.desc: David Dimbleby continues his voyage around Britain, sailing his yacht Rocket along coastal regions of the South East, the first point of attack for enemy forces and therefore essential to the nation's defence throughout history. Along the way, he takes a tour of HMS Victory, Nelson's flagship vessel from the Battle of Trafalgar, lovingly preserved in dry dock in Portsmouth. He also meets a carpenter who still makes wooden figureheads, discovers how a chamber pot acted as propaganda in the battle against Napoleon and reveals the way abstract art was used to deceive German submarine pilots

programme.title: Great Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Victoria Wood makes a round trip of northern England and Scotland starting at Crewe. She visits Carnforth Station, where David Lean shot the memorable location scenes in Brief Encounter, takes a sleeper train from Glasgow to Fort William and stops off at a railway museum in an enthusiast's back garden

programme.title: Victoria Wood: A Bafta Tribute
programme.desc: Julie Walters, Lenny Henry, Richard E Grant and Jim Broadbent gather for a gala honouring the much-loved entertainer, with contributions from Peter Kay and French and Saunders. The celebration offers an opportunity to look back over her career with a combination of celebrity tributes and clips of her work, culminating with the presentation of the Bafta award

programme.title: Victoria Wood: The Secret List
programme.desc: With a career spanning more than 40 years and crossing every possible genre, Victoria Wood amassed a back catalogue bulging with sublime comedy moments. The first of two documentaries offers a unique opportunity to see the very best bits of Victoria's work that she loved the most, drawing on some of the 20 sketches chosen by her in a notebook discovered after her death. Plus, contributors including Russell T Davies, Ken Loach, Winsome Pinnock, Jane Wymark and Joan Armatrading discuss Victoria's broad catalogue of award-winning comedy. Narrated by Sara Pascoe

programme.title: Duncan Preston Remembers - Pat and Margaret
programme.desc: The actor looks back at Victoria Wood's 1994 comedy drama about a successful actress and her dowdy sister reunited after 27 years apart on a TV show

programme.title: Pat and Margaret
programme.desc: A Lancashire-born American soap star visits Britain on a publicity tour, and is horrified when a live TV show organises a reunion with a motorway cafeteria waitress who happens to be her long-lost sister. Comedy drama, written by and starring Victoria Wood, with Julie Walters, Celia Imrie, Duncan Preston and Thora Hird

programme.title: Victoria Wood: The Secret List
programme.desc: With a career spanning more than 40 years and crossing every possible genre, Victoria Wood amassed a back catalogue bulging with sublime comedy moments. This second of two programmes draws on further favourite sketches chosen by her in a notebook discovered after her death. Plus, contributors discuss her broad catalogue of award-winning comedy

programme.title: Victoria Wood: A Personal View - Scene
programme.desc: The writer and comedian discusses her career and her writing, and gives a glimpse of life backstage on her stand-up tour. First broadcast in 1985

programme.title: Mindful Escapes: Breathe, Release, Restore
programme.desc: Mindfulness expert Andy Puddicombe reveals why breathing is so important to becoming still and being in the moment, illustrated with natural history footage

programme.title: Great Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Victoria Wood makes a round trip of northern England and Scotland starting at Crewe. She visits Carnforth Station, where David Lean shot the memorable location scenes in Brief Encounter, takes a sleeper train from Glasgow to Fort William and stops off at a railway museum in an enthusiast's back garden

programme.title: Victoria Wood: A Bafta Tribute
programme.desc: Julie Walters, Lenny Henry, Richard E Grant and Jim Broadbent gather for a gala honouring the much-loved entertainer, with contributions from Peter Kay and French and Saunders. The celebration offers an opportunity to look back over her career with a combination of celebrity tributes and clips of her work, culminating with the presentation of the Bafta award

programme.title: The Sky at Night
programme.desc: The team explores the threat of an asteroid impact on earth and meet space scientists who are developing methods of planetary defence that sound like the stuff of science fiction. Maggie meets Professor Alan Fitzsimmons, expert in asteroid observation, to learn how the latest technology monitors near-Earth asteroids. He explains which ones are a current concern, and why we missed the dangerous Chelyabinsk meteor - a 9,000-ton fireball that exploded in the sky above Russia

programme.title: Railways: The Making of a Nation
programme.desc: Liz McIvor examines how the railways stimulated great changes to the nation's economy, and encouraged a new generation of mechanical engineers, skilled workers, managers and accountants. Originally, local entrepreneurs viewed trains as vehicles for shifting raw materials, stock and goods, however it soon became clear that there was money to be made in transporting people

programme.title: A House Through Time
programme.desc: David Olusoga traces the history of an 18th-century sea captain's house near Bristol's docks with links to the slave trade. Bristol was a major port in the transportation of slaves from Africa's Guinea Coast to the Caribbean, and both the man who built the house and its first full-time resident were heavily involved in the trade. David uncovers stories of piracy, abandoned babies, a household slave who made a daring escape from the property, and a protest on the doorstep as the abolitionist movement gained momentum

programme.title: Tea with Mussolini (1999)
programme.desc: Eccentric English and American women living in Florence during the tense pre-war years of the 1930s experience the ups and downs of parenthood when they collectively adopt a local boy disowned by his father. However, as international hostilities break out, their happy existence comes under threat. Period comedy drama, starring Maggie Smith, Judi Dench, Joan Plowright, Cher, Lily Tomlin and Baird Wallace

programme.title: Summer Holiday (1963)
programme.desc: Four mechanics embark on a fun-filled trip across Europe on board a double-decker London bus, and enjoy all manner of romantic adventures with three young women who hitch a ride on their way to Athens. However, an unexpected stowaway causes a few surprises. Musical comedy, starring Cliff Richard, Lauri Peters, Melvyn Hayes, Una Stubbs, Ron Moody and the Shadows

programme.title: Mark Kermode's Secrets of Cinema
programme.desc: The critic examines techniques and conventions within a genre that mixes film and music and encompasses many forms, from drama and comedy to fantasy and documentary. There is the classic pop star vehicle, where the biggest acts play themselves, or a version of themselves, as well as dramatised accounts of the stars' lives that dazzle with musical set pieces, while playing on the fascination with the darker side of fame

programme.title: Paul Merson: A Walk Through My Life
programme.desc: The football pundit and former Arsenal and England midfielder walks through North Yorkshire, reflecting on his life, career and faith. Carrying a 360-degree camera, he also describes his struggles with drink and gambling addiction

programme.title: A House Through Time
programme.desc: David Olusoga traces the history of an 18th-century sea captain's house near Bristol's docks with links to the slave trade. David uncovers stories of piracy, abandoned babies, a household slave who made a daring escape from the property, and a protest on the doorstep as the abolitionist movement gained momentum

programme.desc: Its the Big Beanbag Bash Day and Love Monster is very excited to throw some beanbags and win some games. Tiniest Fluffiest Bunny does better than he does, and Love Monster feels jealous of the attention that she gets. He becomes so frustrated that he kicks a beanbag and it hurtles towards the scoreboard, knocking all the points to the ground, ripping the bunting and giving Delivery Duckling, Elder Chick, Elder Panda and the In-Chicks a fright. The crowd is stunned into silence. Love Monster is horrified at what he has done and immediately says sorry. He explains that he wants everyone to cheer for him like they cheer for Tiniest Fluffiest Bunny. She admits it did feel good and tingly inside when everyone was cheering for her, but she says that everyone has something they are good at and Love Monster is the best beatboxer in Fluffytown. Love Monster realises that she is right and starts beatboxing. The Fluffytowners start having fun again and begin cheering for him.

programme.desc: Bassist and co-founder of Busted Matt Willis opens up about his experiences battling drug and alcohol addiction and his daily struggle to stay clean and sober. He speaks on the constant fear of relapse and the pressure it puts on himself and his family. Matt looks back on his past and his darkest days, trying to get to the root of his addictions. He visits a rehab unit that made a real difference to his recovery to speak with experts about why he and fellow addicts become dependent on drugs and alcohol before travelling to Imperial College London to meet a research team who are studying the differences in the brains of people with addictions and people without

programme.desc: A painting depicting the Lebanese city of Beirut arrives at the barn. It was painted by Nonny Jackson-Twist's grandfather just after the Second World War. He would very much like to hang the painting in his home, but it's faded, the canvas cracked and in some sections the paint is flaking away. programme.desc: Live chat and topical reports, presented by Alex Jones and Jermaine Jenas

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Lola learns her palliative chemotherapy treatment did not work. Stacey and Martin share a heart-to-heart as they learn that Lily is bullying a girl at school and Sonia steps in to help Kim with her anxiety

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Jay Blades and his team of experts meet Liz from Dorset who brings in a crumbling cast-iron gate built by her brother as a gift for her and her late husband. Horologist Steve Fletcher and leather expert Suzie Fletcher are brought a century-old watch by Nancy who's father was awarded the watch for his bravery on his return from the First World War. Upholsterer Sonnaz Nooranvary takes on a rocking chair that has been at the heart of Anna's family home for decades and is in desperate need of some TLC. Last into the shop is Ruth and her Auntie Roz who bring in a penny arcade game from the 1920s

programme.title: Matt Willis: Fighting Addiction
programme.desc: Bassist and co-founder of Busted Matt Willis opens up about his experiences battling drug and alcohol addiction and his daily struggle to stay clean and sober. He speaks on the constant fear of relapse and the pressure it puts on himself and his family. Matt looks back on his past and his darkest days, trying to get to the root of his addictions. He visits a rehab unit that made a real difference to his recovery to speak with experts about why he and fellow addicts become dependent on drugs and alcohol before travelling to Imperial College London to meet a research team who are studying the differences in the brains of people with addictions and people without

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: I Kissed a Boy
programme.desc: Dannii Minogue presents a dating show for gay men, welcoming 10 contestants to Italy to stay in a beautiful country house called the Masseria. Before the summer of love starts, the boys are matched up based on what they're looking for in a partner, before they have even spoken to each other. After meeting their match for the first time with a kiss, the contenders are encouraged to get to know them and give their new relationship a good shot

programme.title: I Kissed a Boy
programme.desc: It's the morning after the Pride before and the boys are reeling from the arrival of new boy Mikey, who is already turning some heads, Ben questions his feelings for Ollie, and the masseria sees its first love triangle. Everyone has a big decision to make at the first Kiss-Off

programme.title: Frontline Fightback
programme.desc: How a young couple's new glamping business was threatened when their Instagram account was hacked into and taken over. The hacker demanded $500 to hand back control - but they stood their ground. Incidents like this are increasingly common, with more than half of small businesses suffering a cyberattack in the last 12 months. Rav Wilding looks at the work being done by West Midlands Cybercrime Unit to combat the problem

programme.desc: Stephen Nolan probes the issues that matter to the people of Northern Ireland, focusing on the stories of the week and the people making the headlines in lively debates, with viewers sending in their questions via text, email and tweet

programme.title: I Kissed a Boy
programme.desc: Dannii Minogue presents a dating show for gay men, welcoming 10 contestants to Italy to stay in a beautiful country house called the Masseria. Before the summer of love starts, the boys are matched up based on what they're looking for in a partner, before they have even spoken to each other. After meeting their match for the first time with a kiss, the contenders are encouraged to get to know them and give their new relationship a good shot

programme.title: I Kissed a Boy
programme.desc: It's the morning after the Pride before and the boys are reeling from the arrival of new boy Mikey, who is already turning some heads, Ben questions his feelings for Ollie, and the masseria sees its first love triangle. Everyone has a big decision to make at the first Kiss-Off

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Charlie Stayt and Naga Munchetty present a round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Rip Off Britain
programme.desc: Angela Rippon, Gloria Hunniford and Julia Somerville report on the woman whose credit rating was ruined after scammers took out multiple mobile phone contracts in her name. She only found out when she tried to apply for a mortgage

programme.title: Frontline Fightback
programme.desc: How a young couple's new glamping business was threatened when their Instagram account was hacked into and taken over. The hacker demanded $500 to hand back control - but they stood their ground. Incidents like this are increasingly common, with more than half of small businesses suffering a cyberattack in the last 12 months. Rav Wilding looks at the work being done by West Midlands Cybercrime Unit to combat the problem

programme.title: Defenders UK
programme.desc: Investigators search for a roofer who conned people out of more than half a million pounds, and a fraudster who lied to get a job as a Captain with one of the UK's largest airlines

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts and Martel Maxwell tour a Cornish period house with several old cars hidden in the overgrown back garden. Properties in Co Durham and south Wales about to be sold are also assessed

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin Sharp presents from Newbury Antiques and Collectors Fair in Berkshire, where experts Charles Hanson and David Harper help two teams acquire items of value to take to auction. The host also pops across to Bristol to meet the maker of cigar box guitars

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Rob cooks up a storm, while Zara gets to grips with her new role. Bear meets an old college friend with big ambitions

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore explores Beaconsfield recycling centre in Buckinghamshire, determined to save quality items from being crushed. There's a sliding door sideboard for furniture painter Chloe Kempster and a collection of wooden skis for lighting designer Duncan McKean. Sarah herself gets crafty with a collection of knitted blankets and patches. Narrated by Arthur Smith

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman returns to her Kent roots to help a young family currently in London find a new home. Away from the house hunt, Nicki takes a trip down memory lane, meeting up with her best friend from school, before they join Nicki's mother at the family's beach hut in Herne Bay

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: Nigel Havers presents the programme in which five dealers bid against one another to buy intriguing items brought in by members of the public, including a toy cafeteria truck, a surprising key, and Victorian Children's clogs

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: A painting depicting the Lebanese city of Beirut arrives at the barn. It was painted by Nonny Jackson-Twist's grandfather just after the Second World War. He would very much like to hang the painting in his home, but it's faded, the canvas cracked and in some sections the paint is flaking away. However, fine art conservator Lucia Scalisi is only too happy to take on this monumental task. Also being restored are pair of silver Shabbat candlesticks and a dilapidated car jack. Presented by Jay Blades

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong hosts the quiz in which contestants try to record the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Former Coronation Street Sally Lindsay reveals the correct answers and comments on the players' scores

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Live chat and topical reports, presented by Alex Jones and Roman Kemp

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Jay breaks Lola out of hospital for a fun-filled day at the seaside but it quickly goes south as the pair get in trouble with the police after Lola steals a necklace to give to Lexi for her 16th birthday

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The second group of seven hopefuls compete for the chance to work in a professional kitchen for the first time. They must cook a dish they would have on the menu of their own restaurant or pop-up, or feature in their cookbook. With Gregg unwell, Monica Galetti joins John Torode to decide which two will be going home, after which the remaining five work in the Royal Opera House's Piazza restaurant, under the guidance of executive chef Richard Robinson. But only the best will make it through to the semi-final

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars
programme.desc: The semi-finalists have their social media skills tested as they are challenged to sell a local street food brand online, under the watchful eye of TIkTok sensation Uncle Roger. Next, Gordon tasks the contestants to devise a recipe to appear on the front page of Waitrose's in-house magazine, before presenting their creations in front of undercover experts including world-renowned food photographer, Mary McCartney. Who will impress Gordon and make it to the final?

programme.title: Gordon, Gino and Fred's Road Trip
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay, Gino D'Acampo and Fred Sirieix set off on a European adventure, organising a special ceremony in each of their home countries. They begin in Gino's homeland of Italy, where the chef's best friend is renewing his vows in four days' time. The trio jump in their campervan and start to collect the various ingredients they will need to feed the 50 guests. But despite the urgency of preparing a menu, Gino insists they stop for lunch in his home town of Naples and takes them to the oldest pizzeria in town

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter tries to prove he is a genius but ends up being classed as mentally challenged - a development he is quick to use to his advantage. Meanwhile, Lois is taken to hospital suffering from burns, leaving Cleveland to look after the children

programme.desc: Stewie sets off for England to take refuge in his favourite TV show, but ends up taking a detour to Saudi Arabia. Meanwhile, Lois embarrasses Peter at a concert. With the guest voices of rock band Kiss

They begin in Gino's homeland of Italy, where the chef's best friend is renewing his vows in four days' time. The trio jump in their campervan and start to collect the various ingredients they will need to feed the 50 guests. But despite the urgency of preparing a menu, Gino insists they stop for lunch in his home town of Naples and takes them to the oldest pizzeria in town

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter tries to prove he is a genius but ends up being classed as mentally challenged - a development he is quick to use to his advantage. Meanwhile, Lois is taken to hospital suffering from burns, leaving Cleveland to look after the children

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Stewie sets off for England to take refuge in his favourite TV show, but ends up taking a detour to Saudi Arabia. Meanwhile, Lois embarrasses Peter at a concert. With the guest voices of rock band Kiss

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: A trio of stories inspired by viewers' letters, including a tale in which Peter appears with his pals as vintage screen comedy team the Little Rascals, and another in which the Griffins gain superpowers - much to the neighbourhood's astonishment

programme.title: American Dad!
programme.desc: Steve tries to get into baseball to connect with Stan. Roger creates real life drama for Francine after her favourite soap opera is cancelled

programme.title: American Dad!

programme.title: Bob's Burgers

programme.title: Bob's Burgers

programme.title: Superstore

Meanwhile, Dina takes advantage of a medical condition to scam Glenn into accommodating her every need

programme.title: Superstore

programme.title: Wild at Heart

Drama from the wilds of Africa, starring Stephen Tompkinson, Deon Stewardson, Dawn Steele and Cal Macaninch

Rural drama, starring Jason Durr, Fiona Dolman and Bill Maynard

programme.title: Heartbeat

programme.desc: The last run of the detective drama ended with Lewis (Kevin Whately) starting a new life away from the force, but it seems that peace and quiet doesn't suit him - which is just as well, as newly promoted DI Hathaway (Laurence Fox) is struggling to find a sidekick, and within just four weeks is already on to his second sergeant, DS Lizzie Maddox (Angela Griffin). So, Chief Superintendent Innocent (Rebecca Front) decides to reunite the former partners to look into the murder of a neurosurgeon, a case with potential links to the worlds of animal rights and blood sports. In the first of this two-part story, suspicion falls on glamorous widow Erica (Kara Tointon), but it turns out there are plenty of other people in the victim's inner circle who were driven by fear and loathing

However when a coroner's autopsy is ordered, Monty stashes it in a disgruntled Terry's bedroom for safekeeping leading to suspicions that there is more to the corpse than meets the eye. Suzi Quatro and Derek Fowlds guest star, with George Cole and Dennis Waterman

programme.title: Licence to Kill (1989)
programme.desc: While on leave to attend the wedding of his friend, CIA agent Felix Leiter, James Bond is asked to help with a secret mission to capture notorious drug baron, Franz Sanchez. Though successful, Sanchez later escapes and seeks revenge on Leiter, killing his new bride and leaving Leiter for dead. Incensed by this, Bond refuses his next mission from MI6 to go in search of Sanchez, leaving M with no alternative but to revoke Bond's licence to kill. Now considered a rogue agent, Bond goes undercover to pose as an assassin for hire within Sanchez's drug empire, to bring him down from the inside. Spy thriller, starring Timothy Dalton, Robert Davi, Carey Lowell, Talisa Soto and Benicio Del Toro

programme.desc: As India's population grows and cities expand, suburban areas are increasingly encroaching on the natural hunting grounds of leopards. Reporter Mandakini Gahlot joins with the government's Leopard Task Force, assembled to contain the growing threat. In the southern state of Karnataka, Bangalore's surrounding villages have been terrorised by attacks and the frequency is rising alarmingly. She also meets a traumatised teenage boy lucky to have survived an encounter days earlier

programme.title: The Great British Dig: History in Your Back Garden
programme.desc: Hugh Dennis and the team solve a medieval mystery in Coventry, as they search for a monastic grange known as Biggin Hall, which provided produce for the nearby monks at St Mary's Priory. As the team dig deeper, they not only uncover all kinds of exciting artefacts that tell them more about the lives of the monks, but completely redraw the map of what we thought we knew about the grange itself in Coventry

programme.title: Jamie's Comfort Food
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver gives another of the nation's favourite dishes a twist, demonstrating how to make a marshmallow pavlova

programme.desc: Contestants face a series of questions with the answers on moneybags that pass along a conveyor belt in front of them. programme.desc: Part three of three. As Niles continues to recover from open-heart surgery, he masks his fear of death with overconfidence and an elaborate show of zest for life. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer and David Hyde Pierce

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: As the Christmas season draws near, Frasier is furious to learn that Daphne and Niles want to host the family get-together, prompting a feud between the brothers. programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: The brothers visit a luxury spa, where they are astonished to discover they are not enjoying the highest level of service and try to sneak into an area reserved exclusively for its most valued members. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer and David Hyde Pierce

programme.desc: n Birmingham, three couples compete to host the best dinner party. Talisa and her boyfriend Luke kick off the competition with a traditional Italian menu. Luke gets thrown into the ring during a half-time wrestling show. Next, Kelly and her husband Rob dish out hearty pub grub. Sizeable portions are the order of the night, and handyman Rob whips out a tape measure and chocolate balls for a party game that brings the laughs. Retiree Denise and flamboyant and zesty Peter host on the final night

Across the border on Portugal's Algarve, Tony and his wife Sarah have sold their Nottinghamshire home and are looking to start a new life in the sun along with their beloved pair of pooches

programme.title: A Place in the Sun

programme.title: Help! We Bought a Village
programme.desc: The owners of a village in France officially open after two years of renovations. Cameras catch up with the man who rescued an abandoned hamlet in Spain who could now lose half of what he bought. Meanwhile, in Portugal, a couple start an animal sanctuary in their village

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer is fired from the power plant and secures a job as an ice-cream man, but gets so wrapped up in his new career that he puts his marriage in jeopardy. Meanwhile, Marge discovers a new skill as an expert sculptor, using an unusual medium - lollipop sticks

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A look back at some of the most memorable staff and patient stories filmed since 2011 at King's College Hospital and St George's in south London - places where life, love and loss unfold every day. At St George's, 22-month-old Daisy arrives by air ambulance after being kicked in the head by a horse. She has a fractured skull, a bruise on her brain and concussion. As surgeons plan their next move, Maggie, an 83-year-old with a lust for life, has suspected sepsis, and five-year-old Roman has a pencil lead stuck in his ear. His mum Annie says Roman is charming and affectionate but can also be a handful

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Contenders Frankie Boyle, Ivo Graham, Jenny Eclair, Kiell Smith-Bynoe and Mae Martin continue to address the challenges set for them by Greg Davies. At this stage of the competition, it's no surprise that people find retrieving pineapples from a millpond stressful. The comics inventively repurpose umbrellas and - in a fitting climax - Frankie goes to town on a gigantic cat scratching post. As usual, Alex Horne helps maintain order

programme.title: Open House: The Great Sex Experiment
programme.desc: Another group of curious committed couples explore the possibility of opening up their relationships with sexually liberated residents. In this episode, builder Connor and full-time mother Kirstie are interested in bringing another man into their relationship and want to start the process by having a threesome. However, after connecting with resident Nathan, things go off the rails due to Connor's confidence issues. Meanwhile, married parents Chanice and Richardo, who are torn between a threesome or foursome, face an unexpected issue - finding a resident who is attracted to them

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Anna Richardson meets 31-year-old bar supervisor and mum of two Sam from Melton Mowbray who is seeking her own superhero complete with thunder thighs and the smouldering looks of Aquaman. Plus, 34-year-old Tony who has recently left the Royal Marines enlists Anna's help. He already has a son and a dog, but now is looking for Mrs Right to complete 'Team Tony'

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads for Boston to help change the fortunes of a failing Italian restaurant run by two brothers. The eatery's decline began when one of the pair started embezzling money to fund his prescription drug addiction, and things only got worse when the he was sentenced to four years in prison. With the time now served, he has returned, but must first regain his brother's trust before he can save their business

programme.title: The Simpsons

programme.title: The Great British Dig: History in Your Back Garden
programme.desc: Hugh Dennis and the team are in Odiham, Hampshire, searching for the house of Sir Frances Walsingham, the head of Elizabeth I's Secret Service. programme.desc: The broadcaster and former cabinet minister embarks on a journey of self-discovery, walking stretches of the Pyrenees mountain range between Spain and France. programme.desc: Jonathan and Paddington find a treasure map in a bottle

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.desc: The Copycat traps the entire town under a giant dome

programme.title: Ruby Herring Mysteries: Her Last Breath (2019)
