programme.title: Bargain-Loving Brits in the Sun
programme.desc: To escape from her hectic life selling statics, Bambi and best friend Johnny hit the road for a coastal camping mini-break near Marbella, while cafe owners Dave and Sue try to cut costs and put down roots by swapping their rental property for something more permanent

programme.title: 5 News at 5
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Entertainers, a team made up of members of a touring show called 80s and 90s Live, take on the regular quiz experts, while Jeremy Vine asks the questions

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Hoping to topple the quizzing giants are the Blade Runner-inspired Tyrell Corporation, all part of the same online quiz team which they joined two years ago

programme.title: 5 News Update
programme.desc: The latest reports

programme.title: The Pyrenees with Michael Portillo
programme.desc: Michael visits a young couple from Luxembourg who left city life behind to become pig farmers, lends a hand feeding the pigs and samples some of the farm's delicacies. Climbing higher into the mountainous terrain, he shelters in a mountain cabin with seasoned hiker Patrice Tessiere Dufour. Over a hearty lunch, he learns about the customs and culture of the Pyrenees and its people and ends his day at an abbey in the company of Benedictine nuns

programme.title: 5 News Update
programme.desc: The latest reports

programme.title: Holidaying with Jane McDonald
programme.desc: The singer discovers the majestic continent of Africa, unearths the secrets hidden in the markets of Marrakech, and learns the art of haggling. Wanting to discover the outer reaches of the Red City, she takes a tour with a difference when she jumps in a sidecar and gets motorbiked to the city's historic mosque, before enjoying roast lamb in all its glory. Finally, showing there's more to this city than the souks, Jane takes a daring dune buggy drive to the desert before enjoying a Moorish Moroccan feast

programme.title: 5 News Update
programme.desc: The latest reports

programme.title: Alexander Armstrong in Sri Lanka
programme.desc: The presenter heads for the paradise isle of the Indian Ocean, Sri Lanka, discovering its golden sands and historic culture, from the gorgeous Sinhalese areas in the central and southern regions to the less-travelled Tamil north. His first port of call is the fortress town of Galle built by the Portuguese in 1588. Later, he finds out about captive elephants at a foundation where he meets a majestic elephant that has been rescued

programme.title: Killer at the Crime Scene
programme.desc: A landlord discovers a foot poking out of his wheelie bin, outside a property that has just received an end-of-tenancy deep-clean that may have destroyed any evidence

programme.title: Cause of Death: The Coroner's Office
programme.desc: Documentary following the work of senior coroner Dr James Adeley, who runs a team that works from the moment a body arrives in the mortuary through to the inquest. An unvaccinated man is brought into Royal Preston's critical care unit having tested positive for Covid-19 and deteriorating fast. After his untimely passing, the coroners set out to determine if the medicine he bought online to protect himself from Covid-19 contributed to his death

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: The pursuit of a lights-out and dangerous teenage car thief, who is rallying around the roads of Wakefield at 90 miles an hour, is priority number one. One step ahead are interceptors Adie and Sophie, who are lying in wait ready to burst the driver's bubble, and his tyres, with a stinger. In Seacroft, Chris and Chris go into overdrive when a high-performance motor tries to give them the slip and, after cornering a dodgy Audi, the team are forced to stretch their legs to collar the driver

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Good Girls' Guide to Kinky Sex
programme.desc: The bedroom experiment continues as three self-confessed good girls and their guys look for creative ways to improve their sex lives. It seems nothing is out of bounds as the couples try various kinky challenges, involving sex toys, role play, blindfolds, bondage and even a full-sized sex swing

programme.title: GPs: Behind Closed Doors
programme.desc: A look at how patients should decide whether to go to A&E or a GP, including the case of a patient who has recently completed a course of antibiotics for an insect bite on his face. Other patients include a man with a case of gout that has caused his leg to balloon in size and a woman who needs an over-40s health check owing to her family's history of heart disease

programme.title: Wildlife SOS
programme.desc: The work of volunteers treating sick, injured and orphaned animals at a wildlife sanctuary

programme.title: House Doctor
programme.desc: Ann Maurice and Alistair Appleton help a Northamptonshire woman spruce up her country cottage in the village of Welton, hoping to entice a buyer to part with 250,000. An unsightly boiler and fireplace are discreetly hidden and the lacklustre decor is brightened up to lighten the ground floor

programme.title: Milkshake! Monkey's Amazing Adventures
programme.desc: The inquisitive puppet explores different rock formations around the UK

programme.title: Pip and Posy
programme.desc: The pair meet their friends in the park for a game of football, but Posy gets upset when her football shaped lunch box is accidentally kicked into a tree

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.desc: Cap'n Turbot's ship is attacked by a giant octopus, but the pups discover the sea creature is only looking for its baby

programme.title: Legend of the Lost (1957)
programme.desc: A grizzled adventurer living in Timbuktu is hired to escort a mysterious explorer across the Sahara desert in search of a fabled lost city. A local woman joins the men on their quest, but when the trio reach their destination the explorer reveals his plan to betray his companions and leave them high and dry. Adventure, starring John Wayne, Sophia Loren and Rossano Brazzi

programme.title: Born Free (1966)
programme.desc: Oscar-winning fact-based drama chronicling the lives of game wardens Joy and George Adamson, who adopted an orphaned lion cub in Kenya and trained the animal to survive in the wild so that one day it might return to its natural habitat. Starring Virginia McKenna, Bill Travers and Geoffrey Keen

programme.title: The Wrong Box (1966)
programme.desc: Two elderly brothers each stand to inherit a fortune if the other dies first - but one of them is not prepared to leave anything to chance, and begins a series of disastrous attempts on his unsuspecting sibling's life. However, when one of the pair appears to have really died, his nephews conspire to cover it up. Black comedy, with John Mills, Ralph Richardson, Michael Caine, Peter Cook and Dudley Moore

programme.title: Man of the West (1958)
programme.desc: Reformed outlaw Link is left stranded in the wilderness with a saloon singer and a conman for company when the train they are travelling on is robbed. By chance they stumble upon Link's old gang holed up in a shack, but his former partners in crime threaten violence against them unless Link agrees to take part in a bank robbery. Western, starring Gary Cooper, Lee J Cobb, Julie London and Arthur O'Connell

programme.title: Daddy's Home (2015)
programme.desc: A mild-mannered man hopes for his wife's two children to view him as their father. His dreams of perfect family life are threatened by the return of their biological father, a charismatic, motorcycle-riding tough guy, and he pulls out all the stops to prove to his stepchildren that he can be just as cool. Comedy, starring Will Ferrell and Mark Wahlberg

programme.title: Jungleland (2019)
programme.desc: Two brothers try to escape their circumstances by travelling across America for a no-holds-barred boxing match that becomes a fight for their lives. Director Max Winkler's drama, starring Charlie Hunnam, Jack O'Connell and Jonathan Majors

programme.title: Watchmen (2009)
programme.desc: At the height of the Cold War, former superheroes driven into retirement by public outcry are confronted with the murder of one of their number. As they face the possibility of a conspiracy to eliminate them, they must contend with a world edging closer to the brink of nuclear war. Sci-fi drama, based on Alan Moore and Dave Gibbons' graphic novel, starring Patrick Wilson, Jackie Earle Haley, Malin Akerman and Billy Crudup

programme.title: Mid90s (2018)
programme.desc: During the 1990s in Los Angeles, 13-year-old Stevie spends his summer navigating between a troubled home life and a crew of new friends he meets at a skate shop. Writer/director Jonah Hill's comedy drama, starring Sunny Suljic, Katherine Waterston and Lucas Hedges

programme.title: The Yellow Balloon (1953)
programme.desc: A boy dies while playing in the ruins of a London neighbourhood destroyed during the blitz. His friend, who was with him at the time and blames himself, is blackmailed by a murderer on the run, and is forced to steal from his parents to fund the fugitive's escape or be accused of causing his friend's death. Crime drama, starring Andrew Ray and Kathleen Ryan

programme.title: Footsteps in the Fog (1955)
programme.desc: A prominent Victorian gentleman thinks he has got away with poisoning his wife, but his shrewd maid knows the sordid truth and uses it to blackmail him. As the killer's social standing improves, he realises he has to get rid of the scheming servant once and for all, but his plans to dispose of her lead him into even more danger. Period thriller, with Stewart Granger, Jean Simmons and Bill Travers

programme.title: The Long Arm (1956)
programme.desc: A dedicated Scotland Yard police superintendent battles to overcome stress both at home and work, while putting his instincts and scientific knowledge to the task of catching a notorious safecracker. However, the case takes a shocking turn when the elusive criminal commits murder. Crime thriller, starring Jack Hawkins, Dorothy Alison, Geoffrey Keen and Newton Blick

programme.title: First Men in the Moon (1964)
programme.desc: An eccentric Victorian inventor discovers a strange material that defies gravity and uses it to build the world's first spaceship. Leading an expedition to the moon, he is astonished to discover it is inhabited by giant ants and caterpillar-like creatures. Sci-fi adventure based on HG Wells' novel, starring Lionel Jeffries, Edward Judd, Martha Hyer and Miles Malleson, with special effects by Ray Harryhausen

programme.title: Star Trek (2009)
programme.desc: The trainee crew members of the starship Enterprise embark on their maiden flight, which pits them against a Romulan commander from the future who is planning a horrific revenge on those he blames for a tragedy in his own time. Sci-fi adventure based on the original TV series, starring Chris Pine, Zachary Quinto, Eric Bana, Zoe Saldana and Leonard Nimoy

programme.title: Flight (2012)
programme.desc: An airline pilot with a history of heavy drinking and drug use successfully lands a plane that suffers mechanical problems during a fierce storm, saving the lives of nearly everyone on board. While initially hailed as a hero, it later emerges that he was drunk at the time, raising questions about whether he may have contributed to the disaster rather than averted it. Drama, starring Denzel Washington and Don Cheadle

programme.title: Hell or High Water (2016)
programme.desc: Divorcee Toby Howard and his ex-con older brother Tanner embark on a meticulously-planned crime spree, hoping to rob every branch of the West Texas bank that has threatened to foreclose on their family ranch. However, they soon find themselves being pursued by two veteran Texas Rangers. Neo-western drama, starring Jeff Bridges, Chris Pine and Ben Foster

programme.title: The Escapist (2008)
programme.desc: A convict serving a life sentence is resigned to never being released, until he learns that a drug overdose has left his estranged daughter seriously ill. Afraid she will die before he can make his peace with her, he decides to tunnel out of prison - but is forced to make some dangerous bargains to carry out his plan. British thriller, starring Brian Cox, Damian Lewis and Joseph Fiennes

programme.title: Three Hours to Kill (1954)
programme.desc: After being framed for murder and narrowly escaping the town mob, Jim Guthrie returns three years later to find the real killer. Western, starring Dana Andrews, Dianne Foster and Donna Reed

programme.title: Comanche Station (1960)
programme.desc: A cowboy recruits a trio of outlaws to rescue a woman held captive at a Comanche camp and reunite her with her husband in return for a large reward. However, his partners decide the bounty should be split three ways rather than four and plan to double-cross him. Western, starring Randolph Scott, Nancy Gates, Claude Akins and Skip Homeier

programme.title: High Noon (1952)
programme.desc: A town marshal is torn between love and duty on his wedding day as he prepares for the arrival of a vengeful adversary on the midday train. Meanwhile, the townsfolk the marshal has so loyally protected are certain he will be killed in the confrontation and abandon him one by one to face his enemy alone. Western, starring Gary Cooper, Grace Kelly, Lloyd Bridges and Lee Van Cleef

programme.title: Cutthroat Island (1995)
programme.desc: A tough female pirate enlists the help of an educated slave in finding the three parts of a map leading to buried treasure. However, one of the pieces is in the hands of her cruel uncle, and she also has to find the loot before her crew mutinies or the British Navy catches up with her. Swashbuckling adventure, starring Geena Davis, Matthew Modine, Frank Langella and Maury Chaykin

programme.title: Bridge of Spies (2015)
programme.desc: A lawyer in 1950s New York is hired to represent a Soviet spy in a showcase trial designed to demonstrate the fairness of the US justice system. In the face of public condemnation, he argues against the death penalty, a stance that years later leads to his involvement in an exchange of prisoners in East Germany. Steven Spielberg's fact-based Cold War drama, starring Tom Hanks and an Oscar-winning Mark Rylance

programme.title: The Book of Eli (2010)
programme.desc: A man travels across a post-apocalyptic America carrying a book believed to hold the key to mankind's future. He encounters trouble in a desolate town and finds himself pursued by a despotic leader who will stop at nothing to get his hands on the text. Action adventure, starring Denzel Washington, Gary Oldman, Mila Kunis, Ray Stevenson and Jennifer Beals

programme.title: Death Proof (2007)
programme.desc: A psychopathic stalker uses his specially modified car to hunt down and kill women. Several months after targeting a cluster of victims in Texas, the driver resurfaces in Tennessee, where he sets his sights on a group of female friends. However, the headstrong girls turn the tables on the murderer. Quentin Tarantino's thriller, starring Kurt Russell, Rosario Dawson, Zoe Bell and Rose McGowan

programme.title: Barking Dogs Never Bite (2000)
programme.desc: A maintenance worker motivated by a desire to become famous decides to investigate the mysterious demise of several dogs. Parasite director Bong Joon-ho's dark comedy, starring Lee Sung-jae and Park Hyun-nam. In Korean with English subtitles

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Sienna's plan comes crashing down when Leela gets the wrong end of the stick. Later, the Eurovision party at The Dog proves to be a big hit

programme.desc: The chef travels to Los Angeles to help La Frite, an outdated French restaurant that is failing to make any profits. His first step is to try to reconcile the feuding family members who run the business, and so devises a plan to bring them together by using secret filming

programme.title: The Neighborhood

Starring Johnny Galecki, Kaley Cuoco and Jim Parsons

American comedy, starring Julie Bowen and Ed O'Neill

However, when Captain Holt sacrifices an evening at the opera to stay behind at the precinct and help, the two officers clash over how to make the man talk. Cop comedy, starring Andy Samberg and Andre Braugher

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon is uninterested in Amy's career, so Penny, Raj and Leonard try to make him understand that sometimes it benefits a relationship to pretend to care about a partner's achievements. Howard notices Bernadette is uncomfortable around children when she helps him perform a magic show at his nephew's birthday party

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard asks Penny out on a date, and they agree to give their relationship another chance. They soon remember why it did not work out in the first place, but end up sleeping together anyway. The 100th episode of the comedy, starring Johnny Galecki and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon's friends all fall for his sexy twin sister, who is paying him a visit, but he declares he will have the final say on who can date her - an announcement that particularly dismays Leonard. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki and Jim Parsons

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Peralta and Boyle investigate an old case belonging to Hitchcock and Scully from the 1980s. Santiago's uniformed officers and Jeffords' detectives fight over limited resources at the precinct building

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Jake and Gina attend their 20th anniversary high-school reunion. Back at the precinct, Boyle helps Diaz with a decision about her love life. Meanwhile, Holt, Jeffords, Hitchcock and Scully attempt to identify the mystery sound in a radio show competition

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny gets the opportunity to spend time with Bill Gates at work, because his business wants to partner with her pharmaceutical company. programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Howard tries to use his wedding as an excuse to avoid being sent into space, but ends up accepting the mission. Amy plots to get Sheldon to take the next step in their relationship, while Leonard accidentally asks Penny to marry him

programme.desc: As the celebrities enter the second stage of the detox, Kerry Katona throws herself into the therapies with gusto, before tempers fray at the evening's ceremony

programme.title: Below Deck Sailing Yacht

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Grand Designs

Having discovered an old milk yard tucked away behind some flats and shops in south-east London, their long-held desire to build a highly unconventional family home and workspace begins. programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: This episode focuses on the chances people take in life and whether a gamble ever pays off. 20-year-old Megan is rushed to St George's hospital after being involved in a high-speed car crash, and as doctors begin treatment and work to assess her injuries, it soon becomes clear how her hedonistic lifestyle has put her at risk. programme.title: Super Surgeons: A Chance at Life
programme.desc: Professor Vin Paleri attempts to reconstruct a throat cancer patient's entire windpipe - but one mistake could leave him unable to swallow or speak. A woman who had a fybroid removed from her womb discovers it contains a rare form of cancer, and will now need to have her entire reproductive system removed. A patient has a rare cancer growing in the back of his abdomen

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: Paramedics on the night shift find a woman collapsed on the floor and on the verge of a diabetic coma. With no access to her veins and time running out, the team resort to drastic measures. A young woman is in agony with severe stomach cramps. Every time she gets up, her blood pressure drops and she passes out. It's a medical mystery that needs further investigation in hospital

programme.title: Secret History
programme.desc: Dubbed 'The Beast' by Winston Churchill, Tirpitz was Nazi Germany's most powerful battleship. Protected by an elite squadron of fighters, it was seen as invincible, but after 34 failed attempts to sink it, the RAF sent in the 617 'Dambusters' Squadron and 9 Squadron. In a raid in November 1944 they managed to slip through enemy defences and destroy Tirpitz. With eyewitness accounts from surviving RAF crew, one of the Luftwaffe fighter pilots and German sailors, this documentary tells this extraordinary story and offers new evidence to explain the mission's improbable success

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown

Claudia Winkleman stands in for Rachel Riley on letters-and-numbers duty, while Isy Suttie is in Dictionary Corner with Susie Dent is in Dictionary Corner

Angel sets Dick the task of finding and chopping the perfect logs for her Christmas table display in their 12-acre grounds. programme.title: Grand Designs

programme.title: Matt Baker's Travels in the Country: USA
programme.desc: The journey concludes along the west coast of California where Matt learns about the unique growing conditions that make Castroville the 'artichoke capital of the world'. He tries his hand at a different form of farming on America's only ocean-based abalone farm. Further north in Salinas Valley, Matt helps with milking at the last family dairy farm on the coast that produces Monterey Jack cheese. He takes to the water to see a pod of grey whales before paying a visit to the tallest living things on earth, coastal redwood trees, which can grow to 380 feet tall and 29 feet wide

programme.title: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Documentary highlighting some of the most dramatic, extraordinary and unusual moments that UK passengers have experienced, captured by people who were there. He tries his hand at a different form of farming on America's only ocean-based abalone farm. Further north in Salinas Valley, Matt helps with milking at the last family dairy farm on the coast that produces Monterey Jack cheese. He takes to the water to see a pod of grey whales before paying a visit to the tallest living things on earth, coastal redwood trees, which can grow to 380 feet tall and 29 feet wide

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jon Richardson takes on guest captain Johnny Vegas in another round of words-and-numbers chaos. Their team-mates are Alex Brooker and Sara Pascoe, while Claudia Winkleman and Rob Beckett stand in for Rachel Riley on letters-and-numbers duty, and Tom Allen is in Dictionary Corner with Susie Dent. Hosted by Jimmy Carr

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A man suffers serious spinal injuries after falling off a mountain bike. As doctors assess the extent of the damage, his wife recalls growing up in apartheid-era South Africa. A medical team gives emergency oxygen to an 83-year-old woman who is struggling to breathe, and a woman is rushed to A&E after her daughter accidently crashed into a lamp post

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Danni Menzies helps Cheshire couple Alison and Stephen Bulger find a holiday home in the charming town of Marseillan in the South of France for their 115,000 budget

programme.title: Kirstie's House of Craft
programme.desc: Chef Tony Singh and presenter Sophie Morgan compete to make the best holiday snow globes, and TV personality Mark-Francis Vandelli goes head to head with queen of clean Aggie MacKenzie to make intricate jelly art

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: John, a town planner, and Daniel a luxury retail manager, have been together for five years and feel now is the time to find themselves a dream holiday home for their budget of 100,000. Keen to get their teeth into a renovation project, they've chosen the area around Cdiz in southern Spain. Ben Hillman lines up five property options to consider

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: Calamity ensues for a B&B host in Italy when her first pony trekking booking gets off to a terrible start. Plus, a couple of would-be bar owners have to leave the Costa del Sol after failing to find a good business to buy

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Simon O'Brien turns car seats into a three-piece suite during a trip to Leyland, while Henry Cole repurposes an overhead light into a fashionable light box

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien head to the seaside resort of Southport, where Harry comes across some old ammunition crates that he decides to turn into pieces of furniture

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The detectives search for the relatives of a well-liked Essex woman without knowing the value of her estate, and hope that their gamble will pay off when the amount is revealed . Plus, a case from the archives telling the story of one family's escape from war-torn Burma, and details of unclaimed estates

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The search is on for relatives of a Korean War veteran who died in London, and as the case progresses the team is able to help someone meet family members she did not know she had. Plus, the story of a Shropshire woman whose collection of assets included jewellery with a very royal connection, and details of unclaimed estates where heirs still need to be found

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The first visit of the week is to Tower View Hotel, in Blackpool, where owner Jennifer McGirr is joined by friend Diana Carnegie. Daniel Walker and George Gillespie find some unwanted guests in the bathroom and trouble arises at breakfast when some of the guests try ordering off-menu

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The owners visit Church Spa in East Markham in Nottinghamshire on their second evening, where proprietor Daniel Walker and family friend George Gillespie hope to wow their guests with their relaxing facilities. Steve and Lisa Tindall seem impressed, but Jennifer and Diana Carnegie question the high price tag

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third hosts of the week are Steve and Lisa Tindall, who own the King's Head Inn in Rye, East Sussex, where they hope their guests will fall for their boutique B&B. They get into the swing of things with a round of blindfolded mini-golf, but not everyone gets a solid night's sleep afterwards

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Former breakfast TV presenter Matt Arnold welcomes the contestants to The Bridge Hotel Brandon in Suffolk, and hopes that his mantra of 'beautiful beds, blissful bathrooms and brilliant breakfasts' shines through. The group takes part in a rowing competition in the afternoon, but delays at breakfast and a runny egg cause irritation

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The hosts meet for the final time to find out what they have been paid and confront their critics, and things get heated when it's time to count up the cash

programme.title: Come Dine with Me: The Professionals
programme.desc: In and around Newcastle, husband-and-wife duo Steph and Daimon kick the week off in their 'cricket club restaurant' Savoury Fix, at Hetton Lyons Cricket Club. On day two, the boys from Caboose, now known as Dapper and Jazzy, pull out all the stops in service and presentation. The third and final night sees Andy and Charlie, of Asian-fusion restaurant River Beat, put their money where their mouths are with their choice of cuisine

programme.title: Escape to the Chateau: DIY
programme.desc: A recent storm leaves Lee and Belinda's castle keep in need of urgent repairs, with a hole in the roof. Wishing he had a head for heights, Lee has to face his fears in order to get their event space up and running again. Gloucestershire couple Jayne and Steve race to renovate the ground floor ahead of their official B&B opening. As they restore the entrance hall's 130-year-old mosaic floor and repair the salon's panels, a wallpaper mural really puts them to the test

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud follows the progress of teacher Michele Long and architect Michael Howe, who want to restore and transform a 100-year-old blacksmiths in Co Antrim. With virtually no practical experience, Michael wants to do as much of the project as possible by himself. However, the weather on the coastline is fierce, and the freezing weather coupled with a tight budget of 150k means the build is stretched from one to three years

programme.title: George Clarke's Remarkable Renovations
programme.desc: Across Britain, more than 600,000 buildings lie unused and unloved, and nearly a third of them are commercial. Architect George Clarke follows people as they attempt to breathe new life into these properties. First up are Cornwall couple Richard and Sarah, who bought their former local high street bank for 50,000 and now face the challenge of converting the Victorian grade II-listed building into a unique family home

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Moped delivery man Hussnain, 24, is rushed to A&E after being caught up in an accident involving a police car chasing another vehicle. Seventy-six-year-old Edward is brought in due to his breathing difficulties and a serious pre-existing heart condition, while part-time wrestlers Kieran and James come in after Kieran injures his knee in a bout

programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics
programme.desc: A head-on car accident in Cumbria leaves Nick's life hanging in the balance, East Anglian heli-meds land on a roundabout island to help Craig who has come off his motorbike and smashed headfirst into a signpost. Plus, medics battle extreme weather conditions to reach a man trapped under his JCB digger

programme.title: Shocking Emergency Calls
programme.desc: Dramatic calls made to emergency operators, including a report of an escaped tiger and a school book-keeper who had to talk down a heavily armed man. Also, a distressing call taken by emergency call handlers after a young woman found her flatmate murdered in their Gateshead home

programme.desc: A team of battlefield experts set out to scan the site of the Battle of Monte Cassino, one of the longest and bloodiest campaigns of the Second World War II

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Age of Steam
programme.desc: An examination of the major advances made with the invention of the steam turbine, which is still used today to generate electricity in coal-fired and nuclear power stations. Fred also discovers how the country's steam heritage is preserved by museums and societies throughout the country

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Building of Britain
programme.desc: Fred uncovers the construction techniques of stonemasons and carpenters through the ages, focusing on Norman cathedrals. The former steeplejack admires Peterborough Cathedral and Rochester Castle, where he demonstrates how tactics used to invade the fortress centuries ago resemble today's demolition methods

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo begins a journey across Ireland, starting in the port of Wexford, where he takes to the seas in a 100-year-old lifeboat and discovers a hero of the American navy

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: At Trinity College, Dublin, Michael Portillo discovers one of Ireland's greatest treasures, and also explores the house and gardens of Powerscourt in County Wicklow

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo begins this leg of his journey in the East Yorkshire town of Hessle, where he learns about the technology that made the Humber Bridge possible. In nearby Hull, Michael hears from local MP Alan Johnson about anti-slavery campaigner William Wilberforce, before travelling to Scarborough Castle, where the founder of the Quaker movement was once imprisoned. His last stop of the day is York, where he learns what made the city a centre for the sweet-making industry

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo begins the fourth leg of his journey from Derby to Lindisfarne in Middlesbrough, visiting one of the last iron foundries in the town and helping cast a carrot valve for a steam engine. His next stop is Darlington, Co Durham, where he meets the editor of the Northern Echo and finds out about the colourful history of WT Stead, one of his predecessors. Michael then heads to St Paul's monastery in Jarrow, Tyne and Wear, to learn about eighth-century monk the Venerable Bede, known as 'the father of English history', before finishing in Hexham, Northumberland, where he visits a historic ginger beer emporium

programme.title: Bangers and Cash

programme.desc: A First World War story in which German soldiers retreated from angels, examining the possibility of mass hallucinations, divine intervention or something stranger

programme.title: World War Two From Above

programme.title: Joanna Lumley's India
programme.desc: Joanna meets the Maharaja of Dungarpur who shows her around his lakeside palace, and a Dalit community in Gujarat, considered to be India's lowest caste. Braving the roads of Mumbai, Joanna takes a ride in the city's only all-female taxi company and visits the Times of India, where her uncle was editor of the paper in the 1930s and 40s. She then overcomes her fear of heights to explore the World One Tower, soon to be Mumbai's tallest luxury residential building

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Building of Britain
programme.desc: Turning his attentions to timber structures from the Middle Ages the former steeplejack visits England's oldest fortified building with a moat, Stokesay Castle. programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his journey across Ireland, travelling from Navan to Mullingar. Along the way, he gets up to speed with modern archaeology in County Meath, where he uncovers a controversial Victorian dig at the sacred Hill of Tara. Later, he investigates leaping salmon in Leixslip, and in Mullingar, bangs the drum for the town's traditional marching band

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his Irish journey from Dromod to Sligo. Along the way he discovers how the landscape inspired the poet WB Yeats and learns to make a potato pancake

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo sets off from Newcastle on the final leg of his journey from Derby to Lindisfarne, finding out about the world's earliest swing bridge and its inventor William Armstrong. He also travels by boat from the port of Seahouses to examine the story of lighthouse keeper's daughter Grace Darling, who, along with her father, rescued nine people from tumultuous seas in 1838. On the Holy Island of Lindisfarne, Michael explores the lime kilns and finds out how Christianity spread from here across northern England in the 7th century

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on a new journey following his Bradshaw's handbook from south-west Wales to Cambridge, beginning in Pembroke Dock, where Queen Victoria's royal yachts were built. In the little market town of Naberth he investigates what caused rebels to dress up as women, later spending the night at an inn in Carmarthen where Horatio Nelson once met Emma Hamilton. Next day, the former politician pitches in with the volunteers who look after the Gwili Heritage line and ends his leg in Swansea, where he learns how to pose for a photograph in Victorian style

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo begins in the ruinous gardens at Aberglasney House near Llandeilo before riding shotgun in the driver's cab on one of the most scenic routes in Britain. programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo begins underground at Big Pit coal mine in Blaenavon, where he discovers how Victorians toiled night and day to power the Industrial Revolution. programme.desc: Mohammad and Salma Aslam from south London have family with a holiday home on Spain's Costa del Sol, and having spent so many good times there, are now determined to buy one of their own. Jonnie Irwin shows them five properties around Fuengirola for their 120,000 budget

programme.title: Help! We Bought a Village
programme.desc: A couple from Norwich find shoes in their bread oven, and a couple's dream of buying a hamlet in Normandy is in jeopardy when their house sale falls through

programme.desc: The culinary contest arrives in Hull as five more diners hope to claim the grand prize of 1,000. However, her guests prove to be a lively bunch, twerking their way through dinner, and throwing in a few seal impressions along the way

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Wrestling promoter and novice cook James hosts the second night in Hull, and he hopes to wow his guests with a Mexican-themed party complete with a wrestling match as the evening's entertainment. However, his costume requirements, and his spicy food, may be too much for some of the attendees

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Wedding stationery entrepreneur Katrena hosts the third dinner party in Hull, and hopes to impress her guests with a cruise-ship-themed night featuring a pink strawberry soup starter, a sparkling lemon iceberg dessert and towel-folding entertainment

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Mum-of-three Natalie hopes that her choice of good quality produce can help her to impress her guests on the fourth night of the competition in Hull, East Yorkshire. However, the evening does not get off to the best start when community manager George wrongly guesses that she is the grandmother of her two-year-old daughter, and entrepreneur Katrena is insulted by one of the host's questions

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It is the final dinner party in Hull and the turn of community manager George to entertain the guests. Having spent the week heavily criticising everyone else's cooking, the host faces great scrutiny with his menu of simple yet tasty favourites. It remains to be seen whether his egg drop soup and flambeed crepes Suzettes live up to expectations, before the winner of the cash prize is revealed

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Danni Menzies heads to the Correze region in France to help Alan and Joe find their perfect holiday home. programme.title: Escape to the Chateau

With weddings and events on hold for the second year, Dick and Angel bite the bullet and make the big decision to tackle the exterior of the Chateau. The roof and outside walls are their biggest project to date and the Chateau quickly becomes a building site

programme.title: The Big Fat Quiz of Everything

Charles Dance heads up the celebrity question setters, alongside the kids of Mitchell Brook Primary School

programme.title: Night Coppers

But things turn awkward when it turns out she isn't. Determined to prove themselves they attend a suspected arson where they are determined to catch the culprit. Sophie and Rachel investigate a possible street assault that has left a man with life-threatening injuries and Steve comes across a pair of legs sticking out of the bushes. The question is - whose are they?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.desc: In East Sussex, the first hosts are childhood sweethearts Robin and Maria. Robin is the brains behind the cooking, but it's up to Maria to ensure the hosting is spot on. programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts a big fat night of pointless sports trivia, with panellists Roisin Conaty, Judi Love, Joel Dommett, Dane Baptiste, Kerry Godliman and Tom Allen pondering why Paula Radcliffe apologised to the nation, which sports have been played on the moon, and what trademarks belong to Muhammad Ali. programme.desc: Kicking off the competition in Edinburgh are young lovebirds Andy and Pim, who are hoping to impress their guests with a Scottish and Thai-themed menu - with a bit of American thrown in for good measure. programme.desc: Geri Melville is originally from St Lucia, but moved to the UK when she was just nine. Now, she's ready to return to her roots with her husband Ian, by buying a holiday home together on the island she left almost 50 years ago. With a budget of 360,000 Laura Hamilton shows them five properties boasting views of the Caribbean Sea

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc: Sharon and Shaun Garner help Taz and Nicky find a large villa in Almera that can house them and their visiting friends and family, as well as Taz's prized collection of Cortinas

programme.desc: The owners of a hamlet in the Limousin install a 10,000 septic tank, and a couple move ahead with plans for a sustainable lifestyle by buying hens. Plus, the progress of two estate agents who have spent 30 years rejuvenating a village in Portugal

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole comes across a tractor and Simon O'Brien finds a small-wheeled design classic as the pair search for money-making items in Norfolk

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Former property developer Ian hosts the first dinner party in Gloucestershire, hoping his super-healthy menu will win him the 1,000 prize - although it is possible his guests may be more impressed with his 12-bedroom mansion in the country. Some naked antics, a pinata and stories of millions pounds won and lost make it a night to remember

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Then-Miss Cheltenham Sophie hosts the second dinner party in Gloucestershire, hoping her evening of elegant food and pageantry will win her the 1,000 prize. The 24-year-old reveals what she does for a living to her guests, and one attendee makes a surprising confession of her own

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Rugby-loving Carmel hosts the third dinner party in Gloucestershire, and she hopes to impress with a 'Six Nations' starter, a pancetta, king prawn and chorizo main, and a Key lime pie for dessert. An attempt to charm her guests backfires when she likens Ian to a psychotic killer, and the atmosphere takes a further knock after Chris gets on the wrong side of Sophie

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: School teacher Polly, 40, hosts the fourth night of the competition in Gloucestershire, and hopes to impress her guests with a fine-dining experience. She begins with a seafood starter before serving up a meaty main course, and isn't unnerved by the fact she hasn't had any practise cooking either dish. However, her guests show off round the table and threaten to take the attention away from the night, but Ian is highly impressed with Polly's choice of entertainment

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It is the turn of exuberant hair salon owner Chris to host the final dinner party in Gloucestershire with home-made treats on the menu, including a tiger prawn starter, venison for the main and a dessert of chocolate and walnut ice-cream. Chat around the table reveals some differing opinions after the guests make a discovery in the host's living room, and the group reflect on their time together before the winner of the cash prize is announced

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton helps fitness fans Caron and Ivo hunt for a holiday home in Costa Da Caparica, Portugal, on a budget of 300,000. The pair need enough space for Ivo's five motorcycles and Caron's collection of clothes

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud follows the progress of Robert and Milla Gaukroger, as they try to add three extensions to a 1980s property overlooking Windermere in the Lake District. Robert has designed his own heating system to achieve maximum sustainability, but the project begins with only 100,000 of the 400,000 budget in place, and he and his family have to move into the existing building while work goes on around them

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: In Surrey, Kirstie and Phil are searching for homes to bring their house-hunters closer to family. Kirstie meets Lauren, who has decided to move out of her London flat to her own place in Guildford after a serious health scare. She is looking for space to work from home but the high prices in the area leave Kirstie struggling to find a property within budget that ticks all the boxes. Phil meets Eleanor, Laurence and their four-month old twin boys who are moving from Birmingham to be closer to their parents in Surbiton, but with house prices where they are searching being nearly double where they have left, Phil has his work cut out for him

programme.title: Grand Designs: The Streets
programme.desc: Two families from Yorkshire venture into the world of self-build as they attempt to build a new street. Nicola is designing and project-managing a traditional redbrick family home with a modern twist but things start to go wrong when her triangular window, the centrepiece of her vision, does not fit upon arrival. Down the road, Matt and Maryellen are building a flamboyant, Brazilian-inspired home. Steelworker Matt is keen to put his work to good use but Maryellen fears it will make the building feel industrial

programme.title: xXx: The Return of Xander Cage (2017)
programme.desc: The extreme sports-loving super spy is brought out of exile when a lethal gang of mercenaries steal a powerful new weapon that threatens the safety of the entire world. He must assemble his own team of adrenaline junkie agents to recover the lethal device. Action thriller, starring Vin Diesel, Donnie Yen, Toni Collette and Samuel L Jackson

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Contenders Frankie Boyle, Ivo Graham, Jenny Eclair, Kiell Smith-Bynoe and Mae Martin continue to address the challenges set for them by Greg Davies. At this stage of the competition, it's no surprise that people find retrieving pineapples from a millpond stressful. The comics inventively repurpose umbrellas and - in a fitting climax - Frankie goes to town on a gigantic cat scratching post. As usual, Alex Horne helps maintain order

programme.title: Open House: The Great Sex Experiment
programme.desc: A bold new social experiment exploring whether relationships can thrive without monogamy. Cameras follow a group of currently monogamous couples as they explore for the first time whether they would be happier in an open relationship

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Anna Richardson meets 31-year-old bar supervisor and mum of two Sam from Melton Mowbray who is seeking her own superhero complete with thunder thighs and the smouldering looks of Aquaman. programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A nurse shares her story of finding a career she loves, and doctors suspect a 93-year-old man with a low heart rate, dizziness and confusion may need a new pacemaker fitting. A construction worker whose finger has been crushed discusses the importance of male role models in his life, and a haemophiliac reflects on living with his condition

programme.title: Jamie's One-Pan Wonders
programme.desc: Jamie cooks two one-pan recipes that are ideal for busy lives: his take on shakshuka with asparagus, broccoli and harissa, plus an outrageously good pulled pork that can be batched up, frozen and used in loads of meals whenever you need it

programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.desc: A woman is found bludgeoned into a coma, the apparent victim of date-rape. Briscoe and Green track down an employee in the state controller's office who had been stalking her, and find the drug Demerol in his car. Guest starring Sebastian Roche

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Green investigate the murder of an insurance salesman who sold bogus policies to European Jews during the Second World War and soon discover the victim possessed valuable information about specific policy numbers that could provide a link to the culprit. Jerry Reach and Jesse L Martin star

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Detectives Green and Briscoe search for a gigolo suspected of killing an elderly rich woman and stealing a large amount of her jewellery, but as investigations progress, it becomes clear there is more to the murder than meets the eye. Police drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Jesse L Martin

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The team examines the apparently accidental death of a man trying to solve the killing of his son in Chile 30 years earlier. As the investigations gather pace, the officers are embroiled in a belated murder trial

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The team investigates a disabled boy's death in an apartment fire, focusing inquiries not only on a tenant who lived in the same building and had been linked to several previous blazes, but also on the victim's parents, who had struggled to cope with the strain of looking after him. With Jerry Orbach, Dianne Wiest and guest star Rudolph Giuliani

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Green investigate the case of a woman found bludgeoned to death with a paving slab at a subway station. A petty thief leads them to a man with a history of mental problems, recently released from prison, who confesses to the crime and a previous murder. However, the victim's ex-husband wants to know why the suspect was walking the streets in the first place

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A US Navy lieutenant is murdered at the Defence Logistics Agency, while visitings the office of an admiral currently away at sea. As the team investigates the scene of the crime, they realise a rare painting found in the admiral's office is actually an elaborate fake placed there after the killing, replacing the stolen original. As the quest to locate the missing artwork gets under way, the agents realise they need the help of an expert. Luckily, Tony's con-artist father has returned to town, having broken up with his fiancee, and is on hand to provide expert advice as the hunt for the killer takes them into the shady world of the black market. Guest starring Robert Wagner

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A woman is murdered at the home of Gunnery Sergeant Holt Perkins, and while the victim is initially assumed to be the marine's wife, analysis reveals her to be a convicted thief, presumed to be on the scene as part of a plot to hit Perkins' house. When the agents discover the calling card of notorious terror cell Dragon's Tooth on the body, it becomes clear the murder has been committed as part of a wider agenda, and the team joins forces with the Department of Defence to catch the killer. American drama, starring Mark Harmon, David McCallum, Cote de Pablo and Pauley Perrette

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A prostitute and what seems to be one of her clients are gunned down in a drive-by shooting, and when it emerges that the would-be John was actually a Navy officer, Gibbs and DiNozzo realise the killings are connected Lex Tarlionas, an incomplete operation to bring justice to those responsible for an attack on a US airport in 1979, which left 100 people dead. The main suspect is a former Colombian drugs kingpin known as Tomas Orlando, and the murdered sex worker was about to hand over crucial DNA evidence that could have connected him to the crime, but now that she is dead, Gibbs and the others must find another way to finally bring Orlando in. American drama, starring Mark Harmon and David McCallum

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Carisi's niece helps a friend report a sexual assault. Benson investigates a college's secret society that preys on female students

programme.title: Law & Order: Criminal Intent
programme.desc: A radical becomes the chief suspect when Nichols and Eames look into the case of a Wall Street executive murdered during a kidnap attempt. The detectives believe the group responsible is modelled after 1970s German militants the Red Army Faction, and must hurry to uncover their identities before they strike again. Crime drama, starring Jeff Goldblum

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Benson and Stabler are called in when a woman is admitted to hospital after being found in a distressed state on a bus, claiming to have been raped. She tells the detectives it is the fourth time she has been assaulted by the same man over the past 15 years, but runs off before they get to ask any more questions. Crime drama, guest starring Jennifer Love Hewitt

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Stabler and Benson investigate when a teenage girl is killed in a hit-and-run incident at a local farmers' market, but Warner rules it as a murder after discovering the victim was being starved and had recently given birth. The detectives learn she and her brother had been sold to a shady organisation by her desperate father, and US attorney Christine Danielson vows to help expose the traffickers. Guest starring Paul Schulze (Nurse Jackie) and Gloria Reuben (ER)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Benson and Stabler are called in to investigate when Cara Raleigh is found beaten in her home. Multiple sclerosis has left the former opera singer a quadriplegic and unable to speak, but by blinking she informs the detectives she was raped, but did not know her assailant. Cara's sister Janice points the finger of suspicion at three male nurses from an agency who she had fired after some cheques went missing. Guest starring Jill Scott

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Erin puts pressure on a high-school teacher to testify against his brother, one of New York's most feared gang bosses - only for a killer to strike, sparking a fierce debate among the Reagans about her handling of the case. Meanwhile, Jamie discovers a clue that could bring him closer to uncovering Joe's involvement with the Blue Templars. Police drama, starring Tom Selleck and Bridget Moynahan

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Jamie assists a woman in need while he is off duty - but the incident gets out of hand and ends up threatening his career, leaving Danny fighting to clear him. Meanwhile, Sydney and Nicky both make surprising announcements. Drama, starring Tom Selleck, Donnie Wahlberg and Will Estes.

programme.title: Criminals: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Journalist Nick Wallis joins police forces around the nation to discover how CCTV and technological advances are helping to bring criminals to justice. programme.desc: A separated couple blame each other for concealing their missing baby, but the discovery of bloodstains in their apartment suggests another, more tragic explanation. An angry Briscoe suspects the father of murder - until the infant's remains are found, raising the possibility that both parents could be responsible

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Green investigate the murder of a violinist with the New York Symphony Orchestra and find the trail leads back to her Svengali-like conductor. However, they have a difficult job getting the case to trial, with a reluctant witness, a suspicious judge and a talented lawyer standing between them and a guilty verdict

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A gang leader is stabbed to death in a prison scuffle, and Briscoe and Green uncover a number of suspects as it becomes clear the victim had numerous enemies on both sides of the law. The investigation results in a charge, but McCoy faces an uphill battle to convict the accused. Drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Jesse L Martin

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Green investigate the murder of a clothes shop owner during an apparent robbery. An open lock suggests someone who works there was responsible, and the trail eventually leads to the son of the dead man's business partner, whose shady dealings were at risk of being exposed. However, the suspect flees to Israel before police have a chance to question him

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: DiNozzo teams up with his girlfriend, ATF agent Zoe Keates, to investigate the circumstances surrounding the death of a US Marine in what initially seems like a simple road accident. The team reveals the dead man did indeed die due to a broken neck sustained during a crash, but someone shot at him first. As DiNozzo and Keates pursue their inquiry, they discover the victim's death is connected to a controversial ATF plan to place traceable firearms in the criminal system, and then follow them to the heads of crime organisations. Naval crime drama, starring Michael Weatherly

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A US marine visits the home of his former captain, only to find the man has been killed, and the killer is waiting inside the property. While the soldier escapes with his life, the attacker gets away too. It quickly emerges the prime suspect is Qasim, an Afghan translator evidence, and evidence points against him, until it is discovered he has a brother, who is loyal to the Taliban. The subsequent chain of evidence leads Gibbs and Bishop to Afghanistan

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A Naval intelligence ensign is killed in an unusual car accident. Gibbs and his team are reunited with old friend Ned Dorneget, who is now working with NCIS cyber operations, and NSA attorney Jake Malloy to investigate the case, and discover a conspiracy involving terrorist recruitment on the internet

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The team heads to Virginia to investigate a mass murder at an internet security company, where despite many different styles of killings, evidence suggests there is only one culprit. Meanwhile, Prentiss must undertake recertification training before she can fully return to work

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: A PR executive is found dead in a fountain and Stabler and Benson have to untangle a web of love, lies and jealousy in order to find the killer. The victim's husband reveals he had been sent a tape of his wife having sex with a stranger and that she had made several enemies through her work at a soft drinks company. Crime drama, starring Mariska Hargitay

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Businessman Bill Dixon is attacked in his apartment and Stabler and Benson arrive to find that he has been drugged, stripped, tied up, sexually violated and had the word 'ruiner' carved into his chest. They discover a large box had been delivered to the apartment block two hours beforehand, which was probably how the assailant gained access, and then another man is attacked in a similar way

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Investigative journalist Jane Whitmore is found dead in her bed with an X carved into her cheek and her throat slashed. Inquiries lead the team to drug rehab centre worker Ned Bogden, who has been accused of eliciting sexual favours from his patients, and Cragen links him to unsolved murders from the 1970s committed by the so-called Bedtime Butcher. Guest starring Jaclyn Smith, Ann-Margret and William Atherton

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Benson and Stabler are called to the scene when a young man is discovered bludgeoned to death in a storage room at a hotel and a wallet found nearby identifies him as 16-year-old Andrew Hingham. However, when the teenager inexplicably contacts his mother while the detectives are questioning her, it quickly becomes clear this is a case of mistaken identity, and the real Andrew was with the murder victim in a romantic capacity. They propose that he murdered his boyfriend in a jealous rage - a possibility that becomes more likely with the news that Andrew spent time in a psychiatric ward for schizophrenia

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Dick Reed, a rapist and murderer regarded as one of New York's most dangerous criminals, is released from prison after DNA evidence from his trial is discredited. Convinced he will re-offend, Erin tries to persuade the only woman to survive one of his attacks to testify against him - but her emotional scars may be too much to overcome. Meanwhile, Danny and Jackie discover Reed's murderous exploits have inspired a cabal of copycat admirers. Guest starring Toby Leonard Moore (The Pacific)

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Danny investigates the murder of a nightclub doorman, and strikes up a rapport with the venue's female owner - much to his wife's chagrin. Meanwhile, Frank's former partner Jimmy Burke approaches him looking for help winning a promotion - but although Jimmy once saved his life, the police chief is unsure whether he deserves the favour. Police drama, starring Tom Selleck and Donnie Wahlberg

programme.title: Criminals: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Journalist Nick Wallis joins police forces around the nation to discover how CCTV and technological advances are helping to bring criminals to justice. The programme reveals how essential surveillance cameras have become in the fight against crime and features footage of people caught red-handed

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team uncovers a fraudulent charity that preys on those searching for missing military personnel while investigating the murder of a retired Master Sergeant. Meanwhile, Bishop agonises over the results of her probation evaluation, and Tony contemplates adopting a stray cat that followed him home. Starring Mark Harmon, Michael Weatherly and Pauley Perrette

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team investigates the cause of a hit-and-run incident in which a Petty Officer has been killed. Meanwhile, Gibbs works to clear a Navy Hospital Corpsman who has been indicted for illegally providing medical aid to victims of the crash, despite the injured insisting her techniques helped save their lives. Starring Mark Harmon, Michael Weatherly and Pauley Perrette

programme.title: Entertainment News on 5
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: An enigmatic killer shoots dead a businessman spending Thanksgiving at a hotel in the city, then takes his glasses, jewellery and ID to Washington Dulles airport, which has been brought to a stand-still by a massive snowstorm. As the murderer's actions take effect, a terror alert is issued, leaving all northern US airports in a state of panic, and leaving it up to DiNozzo, Bishop and her husband - all of whom are trapped at Dulles by the weather - to bring the armed villain to justice. Crime drama, starring Michael Weatherley

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Part one of two. Best-selling mystery writer PK Todd and her accountant are gunned down outside a restaurant. Miraculously, Todd survives but her companion is mortally wounded, prompting Briscoe and Green to launch a murder inquiry and discover the culprit's real target. However, they soon find themselves mixed up in a deadly case of jealousy and betrayal. Guest starring Ruthie Henshall and Tom Berenger

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The seemingly straightforward murder of a stockbroker plunges Briscoe and Green into the murky world of insider-trading and blackmail, as they learn that the victim led a seedy double life. However, their investigations take on a new dimension when the suspected killer is himself bumped off by a professional hitman. Jerry Orbach and Jesse L Martin star

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The murder of a white teenager in Harlem seems like an open-and-shut case - until two patrol officers are implicated in the crime. As tensions between residents and investigating officers mount, the Mayor puts pressure on Schiff to make an example of the cops, hoping it will be enough to satisfy ADA McCoy. Drama, starring Steven Hill

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Van Buren orders Briscoe and Green to reinvestigate unsolved cases, starting with the murder of a teenager 20 years previously. However, they discover much of the evidence gathered at the time has vanished, and the detective in charge of the case may have pursued an innocent man to protect the real culprit. An unexpected confession allows the case to end up in court again, but legal trickery makes a conviction an unlikely prospect

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A man with a history of violence is arrested for the murder of his son's school ice-hockey coach, but pleads mitigating circumstances. Helped by a glib defence lawyer, he claims that he committed the crime while suffering from a previously unknown mental condition he calls 'sports rage'

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Green investigate the discovery of four bodies in a jeweller's shop. Suspicion soon falls on the husband of one of the victims, who is revealed to have changed his identity to escape a shady past. The shop's security tapes are subsequently discovered in his flat, but the defendant surprises everyone by insisting on representing himself in court - and makes a big impression on the jury

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Director Vance charges DiNozzo with a special assignment to go to France, locate Admiral Kendall's wayward daughter Amanda and bring her home. Arriving in Marseille, Tony immediately heads to the local NCIS office, only to find five dead agents. After eventually tracking down Amanda, the pair embark on a rollercoaster ride to the relative safety of the nearest NCIS office in Spain. Michael Weatherly stars

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The death of Special Agent Ned Dorneget hits the team hard, and when Gibbs receives a visit from his late colleague's mother - CIA Officer Joanna Teague - he must decide whether to let her help with the investigation into the Calling. Meanwhile, Gibbs hopes his young charge Luke, formerly one of the Calling's radicalised footsoldiers, might be key to bringing the organisation down. However, when the terrorists discover where their defecting comrade has taken refuge, the abduct him and flee to Iraq. The team follows hot on their heels, but it seems Luke's ties to the Calling might be stronger than anyone at NCIS ever anticipated. Naval crime drama, starring Mark Harmon, with guest Mimi Rogers

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs fights for his life on board a US Navy hospital ship after being shot. Meanwhile, DiNozzo and Joanna Teague head for Shanghai, where they hope to take down the leaders of the terrorist group known as The Calling. Starring Mark Harmon, Michael Weatherly and Mimi Rogers

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Danny and Jackie are assigned to protect a witness in a major trial involving the Russian Mob. However, their presence does nothing to deter a would-be assassin from making an attempt on her life - and the detectives discover a leak from their department could undermine the entire operation. Meanwhile, Erin is offered an opportunity that could lead to her working even more closely with Frank

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Benson and Stabler are called to an industrial laundry where an environmental activist has been found raped and murdered, with CCTV footage leading them to a car registered to a man who died nine months previously. The detectives visit his son Jason, who tries to make a break for it with a box containing some very odd items, one of which is linked to the victim. Another artefact leads to a woman who reported being raped back in the 1960s, but she now has Alzheimer's and Benson has to talk to her daughter Vivian. The Crime drama, guest starring Alex Kingston, Maria Bello and R Lee Ermey

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Benson is visited by FBI agent Dana Lewis, who claims she has been raped while working on an undercover project, but is worried if she reports it to her superiors they would pull her off the case and everything that she had achieved would go to waste. The detective persuades Dana to let her and Stabler investigate and they follow her to a staged protest against the building of a mosque organised by the group she had infiltrated. Guest starring Marcia Gay Harden (Miller's Crossing, Damages)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The detectives investigate the rape and murder of Laura Santiago, an animal rights campaigner who had been working on a documentary exposing shocking facts about the meat-processing industry. Her mentor, journalist Jake Bradshaw, tells them certain businesses did not like what she was doing and points them to the location of her last shoot

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Stabler's former colleague Jo Marlowe (Sharon Stone) joins the SVU as the team's new ADA and questions a fire marshal's version of events after a man is accused of setting a fire in which his two daughters died. Marlowe believes the suspect's claims of innocence and calls in private investigator Iggy Drexel - who comes up with another theory about how the blaze started. Guest starring Brad Dourif (Deadwood)

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: An unsolved case from Frank's past resurfaces when a boy's body is discovered at a building site - and he struggles to keep a clear head while searching for the killer. Meanwhile, Danny and Jackie investigate the murder of a call girl, but the seemingly straightforward inquiry becomes far more complicated when the FBI becomes involved. Drama, starring Tom Selleck and Donnie Wahlberg

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Danny and Frank investigate the murder of a Russian mobster's son, but the trail of evidence leads them in circles. Erin takes on a high-profile corruption case, but worries she has only been given the job because of her family ties. Meanwhile, Jamie discovers Joe's former partner has committed suicide. Drama, starring Tom Selleck and Donnie Wahlberg

programme.title: Screen One
programme.desc: One-off drama, starring Dawn French stars as a night-nurse in a geriatric ward who murders her patients and makes their deaths look like natural causes

programme.title: Blitz Spirit
programme.desc: Documentary series offering an insight into life for Londoners during the Blitz, which left much of the capital destroyed and claimed 30,000 lives, widening the gulf between rich and poor. The programme features personal testimony from people who lived through the period, and reveals how government information films and the Press played down much of the devastation. Narrated by Christopher Timothy

programme.title: Plane Crash Recreated
programme.desc: The story of US Airways Flights 1549, which lost engine power after a collision with a flock of birds, leaving Captain Sully Sullenberger to land the plane on the Hudson River

programme.title: Two Men in a Boat Chasing Spring

programme.title: William and Mary
programme.desc: As Rick and Molly's wedding approaches, the girls enjoy a wild hen night surrounded by booze and naked men. But as the party gets into full swing, Mary makes a shocking announcement - she's three months' pregnant. William is delighted with the news, but has enough to worry about when the firm is asked to conduct its first Chinese funeral, complete with fireworks. Meanwhile, Kate and Brendan try to slip away together for a night of passion - but next door's rampant rabbit Baldrick soon throws a spanner in the works. Starring Martin Clunes, Julie Graham, Michael Begley and Cheryl Campbell

programme.title: Bleak House
programme.desc: Inspector Bucket jails George for murder, and tells Sir Leicester everything he has learned

programme.title: Sword of Honour
programme.desc: The heartbreaking story of a nation at war, the soldiers who left their families to fight, the social upheaval and the emotionally perilous journey back home

programme.title: Hidden Agenda (1990)
programme.desc: A CID inspector visits Northern Ireland to investigate the murder of an American lawyer and human rights activist. Political thriller, starring Brian Cox, Brad Dourif, Frances McDormand and Mai Zetterling

programme.title: Quest Boxing League
programme.desc: Welcome to the UK's toughest boxing competition, where aspiring young boxers battle it out inside the ring for their chance to be crowned the Quest Boxing League Champion

programme.title: Black Hairapy
programme.desc: Short documentary exploring the relationship between Afro hair and identity within the UK Afro-Caribbean community

programme.title: Time Limit (1957)
programme.desc: A soldier held as a POW during the Korean War confesses to having assisted the enemy during his imprisonment. His superior officers are determined to see him face a court martial as soon as possible, but the investigator assigned to the case suspects he is an innocent man incriminating himself to hide something. Korean War drama, with Richard Widmark and Richard Basehart

Musical drama, starring Elvis Presley, Donna Douglas, Harry Morgan and Nancy Kovack

programme.desc: A profile of the author, which looks at how the writer's childhood and the loss of two of his three children influenced his work

programme.title: Regina: The First Woman Rabbi
programme.desc: Documentary about Regina Jonas, who made history when she became the first officially ordained female rabbi in 1935. Through personal correspondence and newspaper articles she left behind, this film tells her story, from her upbringing in Berlin as the daughter of an Orthodox Jewish peddler, through her studies to her ordination. Featuring Rachel Weisz as the voice of Regina

programme.title: A Shock to the System (1990)
programme.desc: A frustrated executive accidentally pushes a homeless man into the path of a subway train. Realising he has got away with one killing, he begins to wonder how many more murders he can pull off - starting with his rivals at work, his nagging wife and anyone else who has ever caused him misery. Black comedy, starring Michael Caine, Elizabeth McGovern, Peter Riegert and Swoosie Kurtz

programme.title: Horror Hospital (1973)
programme.desc: An aspiring rock star is persuaded to take a relaxing break at a health farm, but gets a rude awakening on discovering his fellow guests all have identical scars on their foreheads. Horror, starring Michael Gough, Robin Askwith, Dennis Price and Vanessa Shaw

programme.title: Wild Britain with Ray Mears
programme.desc: The survival expert explores the nutrient-rich waters around the Isle of Mull in the Inner Hebrides. There, he goes whale watching with local skipper James Fairburns, and comes face to face with the world's second-largest fish. Back on dry land, he observes an otter hunting along the coast, and meets David Sexton - the island's RSPB officer - to examine a white-tailed eagle nesting site

programme.title: Vita & Virginia (2019)
programme.desc: Biopic romance about the life of Virginia Woolf and her passionate love affair with fellow author Vita Sackville-West. Gemma Arterton and Elizabeth Debicki star in the title roles, along with Rupert Penry-Jones and Isabella Rossellini

programme.desc: A database containing the immigration records of more than 170,000 people is accidentally erased, and Nicola and her staff try to keep the news from Malcolm.
